AMENDMENT TO AGREEMENT This is an Amendment (the “Amendment"), to the Reseller Agreement, dated May 12, 2010 (the “Agreement") between Fidelity Information Services, LLC, (formerly known as Fidelity Information Services, Inc.) with corporate offices located at 601 Riverside Avenue, Jacksonville, Florida 32204 ("FIS" or “Company”) and Authentify, Inc., with corporate offices located at 8745 West Higgins Road, Suite 240, Chicago, IL 60631 ("Contractor" or “Authentify”) and shall hereby modify the Agreement to include the terms and conditions, effective on the Effective Date herein. In the event of a conflict between the terms of this Amendment and the terms of the Agreement, this Amendment shall govern. The parties agree as follows: 1. Term; Termination. 1.1 The parties mutually agree to modify Section 9 Term in the Agreement to extend the Term of the Agreement an additional six (6) years, thereby expiring on December 31,2022 (“Expiration Date"). 1.2 The parties mutually agree to modify Section 10 in the Agreement to include the following language: “Company shall have the right to terminate the Agreement and any SOW thereto immediately, and without penalty, in the event of a Contractor Change in Control. "Change in Control” shall mean any event or series of events by which (i) any person or entity or group of persons or entities shall acquire Control of another person or entity or (ii) in the case of a corporation, during any period of twelve (12) consecutive months commencing before or after the date hereof, individuals who at the beginning of such twelve (12) month period were directors of such corporation shall cease for any reason to constitute a majority of the board of directors of such corporation. In the event of a Contractor Change in Control, neither the Contractor nor the entity assuming control of the Contractor shall have the right to terminate this Agreement.” 2. Pricing. 2.1 The parties mutually agree to modify Section 8.1.4 to add sub-section (d) as follows; "In the event Contractor elects to make a price adjustment to the Basic Services pricing, said adjustment shall be in writing, signed by both parties and appended to this Amendment. 2.2 The parties mutually agree to modify Exhibit B, page A-7 in the Agreement to delete the pricing table and sections 1.1, 1.1.1 and 1.3 and replace with the following: Annual Authentify Enterprise Security Transaction Annual Transaction Rate 0 to 30,000 $.16
30,001 to 600,000 $.14
600,001 to 3,000,000 $.12
3,000,001 to 9,000,000 $.10
9,000,001 to 18,000,000 $.08
18,000,001 to 26,000,000 $.07
Over 26,000,000 $.05
Annual Authentify Enterprise Security SMS Delivery Annual Transaction Rate 0 to 30,000 $.09
30,001 to 600,000 $.08
600,001 to 3,000,000 $.07
3,000,001 to 9,000,000 $.06
9,000,001 to 18,000,000 $.05
18,000,001 to 26,000,000 $.04
Over 26,000,000 $.03
The annual transaction rate will be based on the previous twelve (12) months total volume. The first (12) twelve months rate will be based on the 9 million to 18 million tier. Company will not be responsible for any volume commitments to Contractor. Company will pay, on a monthly basis, the lowest transaction rate based on total annual volume for all transactions (Transaction or SMS Delivery, combined together) across all Company business units, and applications. Any accumulated transactions from the CeB Ext Trans service will be applied to the CeB volume. Pricing is global. 3. Confidentiality; Privacy; Data Security. 3.1 The parties mutually agree to delete and replace Section 12 Confidentiality in the Agreement and replace with the following: Confidential Information. Each Party must protect the other's confidential information ("Confidential Information") with the same degree of care used to protect its own confidential information, but in no event may less than a reasonable standard of care be used by either Party in connection with the preservation of the other’s confidential information. Without limiting the foregoing, Contractor shall treat as FIS’s Confidential Information all information received from FIS that is designated as “confidential” at or prior to disclosure. FIS designates as FIS Confidential Information (i) this agreement, (ii) any information obtained from or related to any client of FIS including, without limitation, FIS client business strategy, direction and contract information, (iii) any “non-public personal information” as defined in the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (12 CFR Part 573) or Section 504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (“NPI”) or information that is protected under any health privacy such as HIPAA or its state law equivalents, (iv) FIS’s employee records (name, address, salary, taxpayer or government identification number, date of birth, health records, bank account information, labor party), (v) any business strategies and directions, operating or marketing plans, intellectual capital or trade secrets, (vi) memos or other documents or communication; and pertaining to pending litigation, or contracts, and (vii) specifications, research, discoveries, ideas, know-how, designs, drawings, flow charts, budget figures, and other financial and business information, or any such information of FIS’s clients, parents, affiliates, subsidiaries or agents, which is disclosed, regardless of the manner of disclosure, to Contractor. Contractor shall (I) restrict the use and disclosure of the FIS’s Confidential Information to its employees solely on a "need to know" basis in order to perform Contractor's obligations in accordance with the Agreement, (ii) ensure that its employees are bound to it by confidentiality obligations at least as protective of the other as FIS’s Confidential Information as the provisions of this section, (iii) require employees to protect and restrict the use of the FIS’s Confidential Information, (iv) establish procedural, physical and electronic safeguards, designed to meet the objectives of the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Interagency Guidelines to prevent the compromise or unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information, and (v) not use or disclose FIS’s Confidential Information except as expressly provided in the Agreement. Contractor shall notify FIS within twenty-four (24) hours of: (i) any actual unauthorized possession or use of FIS’s Confidential Information; (ii) the effect of such use or possession; and (iii) the corrective action taken in response thereto. Contractor acknowledges that FIS may be required to also notify its customers of such security incidents and agrees to cooperate with FIS in making such notification to such customers. The costs of such notifications, and any other costs related to such unauthorized possession or use shall be the sole responsibility of Contractor. Confidential Information shall remain the property of the party from or through whom it was provided. Except for NPI, Contractor shall not be obligated to preserve the confidentiality of any information that: (i) was previously known; (ii) is a matter of public knowledge; (iii) was or is independently developed; (iv) is released for disclosure with written consent; or (v) is received from a third party to whom it was disclosed without restriction. Disclosure of Confidential Information other than NPI shall be permitted if it is: (a) required by law; (b) in connection with the tax treatment or tax structure of the Agreement; or (c) in response to a valid order of a U.S. court or other governmental body, provided that Contractor provides FIS with written notice and FIS is afforded a reasonable opportunity to obtain a protective order. Upon termination of the Agreement, Contractor shall destroy all FIS Confidential Information in a manner designed to preserve its confidentiality, or, at the other party’s written request and expense, return it to the disclosing party FIS shall have and retain all right, title and interest in all of FIS’s Confidential Information possessed by FIS prior to, or acquired or refined by FIS (either independently or in concert with Contractor) during Term of the Agreement. Contractor shall not export any of FIS’s Confidential Information or other data to any country outside of the United States other without the prior written consent of FIS. 2 Privacy. If and to the extent Contractor receives, stores or accesses any NPI or other materials that, in FIS's reasonable determination, are the subject of relevant privacy laws, rules or Privacy Regulations, then Contractor agrees to comply with the requirements of such Privacy Regulations. In addition to those obligations and the obligations otherwise set forth in the Agreement, as to NPI received by Contractor, Contractor agrees to (i) ensure the security and confidentiality thereof; (ii) protect against any anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such records; (iii) detect unauthorized access to or use of such records or information and (iv) protect against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information that would result in harm or inconvenience to any customer of FIS (the “Safeguarding Objectives”). Contractor represents and agrees that it has and will maintain in place commercially reasonable precautions to safeguard the confidentiality, security and integrity of FIS Confidential Information in a manner designed to meet the Safeguarding Objectives. These precautions shall include (i) contractual restrictions on access to the information by vendors and contractors, (ii) intrusion detection systems on all information systems of FIS maintained or controlled by Contractor, and (iii) notification procedures for notifying FIS promptly in the event a security breach is detected, as well as other response programs when there is a detected unauthorized disclosure, access or attempted access of non-public personal information. These precautions shall also include, as appropriate: (i) access controls to FIS information systems, including controls to identify and permit access only to authorized individuals and controls to prevent access to FIS Confidential Information through fraudulent means; (ii) employee controls and training; (iii) physical access restrictions at locations where FIS Confidential Information is located; (iv) encryption of electronic FIS Confidential Information when appropriate or legally required; and (v) a disaster recovery plan as appropriate to protect against loss or damage to FIS Confidential Information due to potential hazards such as fire or water damage or technological failures. Contractor shall (i) monitor the foregoing measures with periodic audits or testing and (ii) provide copies of the same sufficient to assure to FIS or its regulatory authorities that Contractor is implementing provisions of the Agreement. Contractor shall notify FIS immediately in the event there is any actual unauthorized access, use, disclosure or alteration to FIS Confidential Information. Contractor shall indemnify FIS from, defend FIS against, and pay any final judgments awarded against FIS, resulting from any claim brought by a third party, including but not limited to a customer of FIS, against FIS based on any breach of the Privacy Regulations by Contractor. Data Security. Contractor shall be responsible for establishing and maintaining an information security program to (i) ensure the security and confidentiality of Customer Data that may come into the possession or control of Contractor, (ii) protect against any anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of such Customer Data that may be in the possession of Contractor, and (iii) protect against unauthorized access to or use of such Customer Data that could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to FIS, or any of such FIS’S customers. In the event that any communications link (defined as a pre-established communications path from the customer premises, through a carrier network, to the FIS network) exists between any of Contractors' systems or servers and any of FIS’systems or servers on which Customer Data is stored: 1. Contractor shall, at its sole expense, be responsible for maintaining security for its own systems, servers, and communications links as necessary to protect FIS networks. Security controls should include, but not be limited to: (i) Anti-Virus/Malware Devices, (ii) DMZ Subnet and Firewall Controls, (iii) IDS/IPS Controls, (iv) Patch Management Controls, (v) Physical Security Controls, and (v) Change Management controls. 2. Contractor will notify FIS of any and all breaches to Contractor’s security and work with FIS management to identify the root cause of the incident and the potential impact to FIS, as reasonably requested. 3. Contractor will, at its sole expense, contract with an appropriately qualified third party security assurance vendor, to have performed, on a regular basis, a security assessment that includes intrusion testing. Results of these tests will be forwarded to FIS upon written request from FIS. If after reviewing such test results, FIS believes that additional testing is warranted, FIS and Contractor shall discuss such additional testing in good faith. In the event that FIS provides Contractor with FIS user-id’s to access FIS’ applications, systems or servers: 1. Contractor shall limit the number of personnel requesting user-id’s to those individuals that are directly engaged to provide the services under this agreement. Contractor will provide FIS with the full legal name of any personnel that will be issued a user-id. FIS reserves the right to deny any user-id request. 2. Contractor shall not permit any of its personnel to share any FIS user-id. 4. Minimum Insurance Requirements. Contractor shall maintain at its own expense during the term of the Agreement insurance covering its operations in the following minimum amounts: 3 1. Commercial General Liability Insurance: including Premises & Operations, Products/Completed Operations, Contractual, Broad Form Property Damage, and Personal Injury with a combined single limit of not less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence and Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000) general aggregate. 2. Business Automobile Liability Insurance: for all non-owned, and hired vehicles to be used in connection with the Agreement, with a combined single limit of at least One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) each accident 3. Worker’s Compensation: One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) Employers Liability coverage. 4. Umbrella (Excess) Liability Insurance coverage in an amount of not less than four million ($4,000,000) per occurrence 5. Property Insurance: against all risks of physical loss or damage to any property in control of Contractor. 6. Professional Liability: Primary policy in the amount of Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000) including coverage for Network Security Liability and Privacy Liability. Excess limit of Three Million Dollars ($3,000,000) with a total of Five Million Dollars ($5,000,000) coverage. 7. Commercial Crime: including employee Dishonesty coverage in the amount of not less than Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000). Contractor Responsibilities. (a) Prior to executing the Agreement and within ten (10) days of each subsequent policy renewal, Contractor shall provide FIS with certificates of insurance evidencing that the coverage and policy endorsements required under the Agreement are maintained in force with insurance companies that have A.M. Best ratings of at least A (VIII). (b) Contractor or its insurers shall provide thirty (30) days written notice to FIS prior to cancellation or material change of any such policy. (c) Except with respect to the sole negligence of FIS, Contractor's policies will be primary and non-contributing with respect to any other insurance or self-insurance which may be maintained by FIS. (d) FIS shall be named as an additional insured under the Commercial General Liability and Automobile Liability policies described. (e) Contractor and its Insurance Carriers shall waive subrogation with respect to the Workers Compensation, Employers Liability, Commercial General Liability and Automobile Liability policies. (f) If subcontractors are to be utilized in providing any Services under the Agreement, Contractor will be responsible to ensure that such subcontractors maintain in force coverage as outlined in this section, or that coverage is extended under Contractor’s policies. (g) The carrying of the above-described coverage shall in no way be interpreted as relieving the Contractor of any other responsibility or liability under this agreement or any applicable law, statute, regulation or order. FIDELITY INFORMATION SERVICES, LLC. 601 Riverside Avenue Jacksonville, Florida 32204, USA Name and Title Effective Date 4

Schedule Number 05 This Schedule Number 05 (“Schedule”) is effective as of July 28, 2021, and is made a part of the Master Services Agreement dated as of July 28, 2019 (“Master Agreement”) entered into by and between FIS Global Solutions Philippines, Inc. (‘FIS’) and Integrated Building Electronics Systems Technologies Corporation (“iBest or Contractor”). The terms and conditions of the Master Agreement are incorporated, by reference, into this Schedule. NOW, THEREFORE, the parties hereto agree as follows: 1. Scope of Contractor’s Services: Contractor shall perform the following Services and create and deliver the following deliverables: CCTV SYSTEM 1. Digital Video Recorder/ Power Supply/ Camera Unit • Check location / focus • Check camera type • Verify Camera Specs (IR, Fixed or Varifocal, Weather Proof, Vandal Proof) • Check physical status / Check enclosure • Check camera mounting position and mounting screws • Adjust camera field of view to customer’s requirements • Check camera focus and auto iris and adjust if necessary. • Verify field of view • Check camera lens • Check for any sign of tamper, scratches • Clean the device 2. Power Supply • Verify camera input supply • Measure the supply • Check the camera power connectors • Check wires, splice and terminations 3. Video / Audio Output • Check camera output video using portable monitor • Check camera video output connectors (IO/BNC) • Check camera to Network Switch connections (UTP/COAX) / NVR/DVR connections (cable) • Check audio connections • Retighten connections and terminals if needed 4. Wiring and Connectors • Inspect physical status of wires / cables • Inspect all connectors and terminals ACCESS CONTROL SYSTEM 1. Magnetic Lock/ Emergency Door Release/ Door Contact/ Proximity or Biometric Reader/ Reader Module & Controller/ Network Device • Check mounting condition, • Check physical status and its enclosure • Verify Model. • Adjust mounting position and re-tighten screws lock if needed. • Clean the unit. • Test the unit standard operation. 2. Power Supply • Verify hardware input supply • Measure the supply • Check the unit power supply connectors • Check wires, splice and terminations 3. Machine Servers/ Client Machine (Workstation/Desktop PC) • Verify hardware current capacity. • Check all running applications. • Check all memory, storage status. • Check the unit power supply connectors. • Check all accessories connected. • Check audit Logs. • Perform backup of current configurations. 4. Wiring and Connectors • Inspect physical Status of wires / cables • Inspect all connectors and terminals Contractor will also include Emergency calls during and after-office hours - including Saturdays, Sundays and Holidays per quarter. As a condition for receipt of payment hereunder, Contractor will execute, and will have each Contractor resource performing Services under this Schedule to execute, a Nondisclosure Agreement in the form set out in Appendix B to the Master Agreement. 2. FIS Responsibilities: FIS will have the following responsibilities for this effort: 2.1 FIS will periodically communicate its requirement for the responsibility levels to Contractor 3. Term of Services: The Services will commence on July 28, 2021 and shall continue to be provided through July 27, 2023, unless terminated earlier pursuant to the Master Agreement. The term of this Schedule may be extended by mutual written agreement of the parties hereto. 4. Location of Work: The Project work will be performed at the following FIS locations: • 4F, 7F and 9F Floor Ecoplaza Building , 2305 Chino Roces Avenue, 12 initials Extension, Makati City • 15F and 16F Robinsons Cyberscape Alpha, Garnet Road, Ortigas Center, Pasig City 5. Fees: In consideration for the performance of Services hereunder, Contractor shall invoice FIS on a fixed fee basis in accordance with the following schedule - Annexure A: MAKATI: DATE OF PAYMENT AMOUNT OF FEE

By: Name: Title: Date:  Rolande-R^fnandez Jr. Service Delivery Director  Vetting No. FIS/2021/167 Integrated Building Electronics Systems Technologies CjorporaJjoni By:  Name: Thoma^Dignadje^ Title: ManaqinqTJifector Date:  20  initials  initials ATTACHMENTB NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT The parties to this agreement (the “Agreement”) are Integrated Building Electronics Systems Technologies Corporation. (“iBest or Contractor”), Mr. Thomas Dignadic, Managing Director of Contractor (“Contractor’s Personnel”), and FIS Global Solutions Philippines, Inc.. (“FIS”). In consideration of the utilization of Contractor’s Personnel by Contractor in order to fulfill certain obligations pursuant to that certain Master Services Agreement ("Master Agreement”), dated July 28, 2021 made by and between Contractor and FIS, the undersigned Contractor's Personnel hereby covenants and agrees as follows: 1. Confidentiality and Proprietary Rights. Contractor’s Personnel acknowledges that all information relating to FIS or FIS’ client that may be disclosed to or developed by Contractor’s Personnel during the term of the Master Agreement and any of its Schedules, and all reports, documents, manuals, programs, listings, software and other materials, ideas and work product relating to FIS, FIS’ clients, or Contractor’s Personnel’s activities hereunder (the “Confidential Information”), in whatever form and whether or not developed by Contractor’s Personnel, are and will be the sole property of FIS, will be considered works made for hire, and are and will constitute valuable trade secrets of FIS. Contractor’s Personnel further acknowledges that FIS would neither enter into the Master Agreement nor permit the involvement of Contractor’s Personnel unless FIS were assured that all such Confidential Information would be held in confidence by Contractor’s Personnel. Contractor’s Personnel will hold the Confidential Information in confidence, will take his or her best security precautions to safeguard the Confidential Information from theft or from access by unauthorized persons, and will not, directly or indirectly, for any reason, disclose or divulge any Confidential Information to any person other than to FIS and its employees. If Contractor’s Personnel becomes aware of any unauthorized possession or use of Confidential Information, Contractor’s Personnel will promptly notify FIS, in writing, of the nature of such unauthorized possession or use. Contractor’s Personnel will not utilize or cause or permit to be utilized the Confidential Information for his or her own benefit or for the benefit of any person or entity other than FIS. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information will not include any information that is: (i) in the public domain at the time of disclosure, (ii) lawfully obtained by a third party, or (iii) disclosed by FIS to third parties without restrictions as to disclosure. Contractor’s Personnel acknowledges that his or her obligation to keep confidential FIS’ Confidential Information shall survive beyond the term of the Master Agreement, even in the event that Contractor’s Personnel may leave the employ of Contractor or cease work on a Schedule. 2. Any intellectual property rights related to the FIS’ proprietary software applications which may arise as a result of Contractor’s Personnel’s activities hereunder shall immediately vest in FIS. Contractor and Contractor's Personnel hereby each agrees to waive, and does hereby waive, unconditionally and irrevocably, any and all of any moral rights and rights of a similar nature which Contractor or Contractor’s Personnel now or in the future may have in the work performed for or on behalf of FIS (including rights in such workthat may come into existence after the date thereof) in which copyright may subsist in each jurisdiction throughout the world, to the extent that such rights may be waived in each 21 initials respective jurisdiction. Contractor and Contractor’s Personnel each represents and warrants, that to the extent permitted in each respective jurisdiction, such work may be maintained, changed, modified, and/or adapted by FIS without infringing or violating any moral right or right of a similar nature of any person or entity. 3. With respect only to the Confidential Information, if the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement conflict with the terms and conditions set forth in any agreement between Contractor and Contractor’s Personnel, then the terms and conditions of this Agreement shall govern. 4. Remedies. Contractor’s Personnel acknowledges that a breach of the foregoing covenants may not be adequately compensable by money damages alone. Accordingly, Contractor’s Personnel acknowledges that in the event of a breach of agreement, FIS, at its option and without waiving its right to seek money damages, may obtain specific performance of the covenants of confidentiality and limited use contained herein. 5. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Philippines and the place of jurisdiction shall be Manila. data.text: Amendment No. 8 to Enterprise Software and Services Option This Amendment No. 8 ("Amendment”) is effective when signed by all parties and amends the terms of the Enterprise Software and Services Option ("ESSO”), dated as of November 1, 2006, between Fidelity Information Services, LLC (“FIS” or “you”, "Client”), and International Business Machines Corporation ("IBM”) as amended by Amendment No. 7 dated December 29, 2017, Amendment No. 6 dated September 30, 2017, Amendment No. 5 dated September 30,2017, Amendment No. 4 dated December 30,2016, Amendment No. 3 (duplicate Amendment No. used) dated December 30, 2014, Amendment No. 3 dated March 31, 2014, Amendment No. 2 dated March 30,2011 and Amendment No. 1 dated December 31,2009 (collectively, known as the "Agreement"). Capitalized terms used in this Amendment, the definitions for which are not found in this Amendment, are defined in the Agreement or the applicable Associated Document(s). In the event of a conflict between the terms of the Agreement and this Amendment, this Amendment shall prevail. 1. Contract Term Notwithstanding the End Date set forth in the Agreement this Amendment is effective as of July 31,2018 ("Start Date”), and remains in effect up to and including July 31, 2023 (“End Date”), unless earlier terminated as provided in the Agreement. 2. ESSO Offerings The ESSO Offerings that qualify for the terms of this Amendment (“ESSO Offerings”) may only be acquired directly from IBM, are described below, and are in addition to the ESSO Offerings acquired prior to the Amendment No. 8 Start Date: m. The licenses for Eligible Programs under this Amendment do not expire provided the Client remains in compliance with their obligations under the Associated Documents and this Amendment. IBM will not withdraw the QRadar Software Product prior to the End Date of Amendment No. 8. 3. To be eligible for the pricing referenced in this section, the Programs: (1) cannot be deployed prior to the time of the order, and (2) must be made generally available by IBM to its clients (e.g., not withdrawn from marketing and/or S&S), and (3) must be ordered directly from IBM by providing written authorization to IBM (e.g., order form, order letter, purchase order) prior to the Expiration Date to qualify for the pricing set forth in this paragraph: FPM Ranges Part Number Description Quantity Price FPM lOOKto IM D1RQTLL IBM QRadar Flows Capacity 100K Flows Per Minute License + SW Subscription & Support 12 Months 9 $286,703.28     ■■ FPM IM to 2.5M D1RQTLL IBM QRadar Flows Capacity 100K Flows Per Minute License + SW Subscription & Support 12 Months 15 $411,930.00      FPM 2.5M to 4M D1RQTLL IBM QRadar Flows Capacity 100K Flows Per Minute License + SW Subscription & Support 12 Months 15 $346,021.20      FPM 4M to 6M D1RQTLL IBM QRadar Flows Capacity 100K Flows Per Minute License + SW Subscription & Support 12 Months 20 $373,483.20      FPM 6M+ (purchased in 2M increments) O1RQTLL IBM QRadar Flows Capacity 100K Flows Per Minute License + SW Subscription & Support 12 Months 20 $285,604.80 For clarity, the FPM must be purchased as a bundle at the quantities shown in the table. Charges The Option Charges outlined below pertain to this Amendment only. All other Option Charges under the Agreement, including any prior Amendments, remain due pursuant to their terms. The Option Charges are exclusive of any applicable duties, fees and taxes. Client is responsible for any such duties, fees and taxes including, but not limited to, withholding taxes and, if as a result of Client’s moving, accessing or using any of the ESSO Offerings across a border, any customs duty, tax, levy or fee (including withholding taxes for the import or export of any such ESSO Offering). The Option Charges are not cancelable except as may be otherwise provided in the section of this Agreement entitled “Termination”. 6. Settlement of Deferred Payments   Upon termination, you will pay to IBM all amounts due and payable up to the effective date of the termination, including, but not limited to any amounts due pursuant to the Section of this Agreement entitled “Eligible Use of Programs,” the Deferred Payments Settlement Amount set forth below, plus any taxes which arise on or before the date of the termination. The Deferred Payments Settlement Amount represents the payment of the non-financed amounts included in the Option Charges, payment of which IBM agreed to defer. Your obligation to pay the Deferred Payments Settlement Amount is absolute and unconditional and shall not be affected by any right of defense or counterclaim of any kind whatsoever. By signing below, the parties agree to the terms of this Amendment. If there is a conflict among terms of this Amendment, all prior Amendments and those of the Agreement, this Amendment prevails. INTUIT MARKETING ANDIMPORT AGREEMENT This Marketing and Import Agreement, including all the attached schedules, exhibits, and addenda (collectively, the “Agreement"), as applicable, Is entered into as of the last signature date below ("Effective Date") by and between Intuit Inc, ("Intuit"), a Delaware corporation, with offices at 2535 Garcia Avenue. Mountain View, California 94043 and the financial institution named below, on behalf of those of its direct or indirect subsidiaries and/or affiliates, If any, as identified below (collectively referred to hereafter as "Financial institution"). WHEREAS, Intuit manufactures various Intuit Products (defined below) that are used by individuals and professionals to manage personal finances; and WHEREAS, the Intuit Products include functionality that permits the user to import certain financial information from participating third party financial institutions through intuit's Open Financial Exchange (OFX) Import Program (the “Program"); and WHEREAS, Financial Institution desires to participate In the Program; NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, Intuit and Financial Institution agree to the terms set forth In this Agreement. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, each party's authorized signatory has read, understands and agrees to the terms and conditions set forth In this Agreement. YOU MUST PRINT, SIGN AND RETURN TWO (2) ORIGINALS OF THIS ENTIRE MARKETING AGREEMENT AS NOTED BELOW. A FULLY EXECUTED ORIGINAL WILL BE RETURNED TO YOU. Intuit Inc. Intuit Financial Institution Group eFax: 1-858-408-2847 INTUIT MARKETING AND IMPORT AGREEMENT ■ Terms and Conditions 1. DEFINITIONS. In addition to any capitalized terms elsewhere defined in the Agreement, the following capitalized terms shall have the same meaning given them below for the purposes of this Agreement. 1.1 “Affiliated Entities" shall mean an entity controlling, controlled by or under common control with a party to the Agreement during the Term hereof where control means the ownership or control, directly or Indirectly, of more than fifty percent (50%) of ail of the voting power of the shares (or other securities or rights) entitled to vote for the election of directors or other governing authority. 1.2 "Confidential Information” shall mean information disclosed under this Agreement by or on behalf of a Disclosing Party concerning its business or activities that (a) would be reasonably considered to be proprietary or confidential. Including: business, operational, customer, financial and technical Information; business plans and forecasts; Information about the Disclosing Party's products and senrices (e.g., launch and release dates, product development plans, new or Improved features, technical architecture and system design; preliminary versions of software or financial services); or (b) is marked or designated by such party as “confidential" or "proprietary” at the time of disclosure. “Confidential Information" does not Include Information that; (w) is publicly available or is obtained lawfully from third parties without breach of any duty of confidentiality; or (x) has been developed independently by the other party without reliance on such Confidential Information; (y) is in possession of the other party prior to such disclosure, and is not subject to any confidentiality or nondisclosure obligations; or (z) is customer Information, If the disclosure is authorized or requested by the customer. 1.3 "Content” shall mean any promotional material and information used lo promote and market the Intuit Products. 1.4 "DARTS” shall mean Direct Access Rights to Technical Support as further identified In Schedule 4 ("Passport and DARTS Support"). 1.5 “Data" shall mean, but not be limited to, customer transactions and balances related to demand deposit accounts ("DDAs”), money market, savings, lines of credit, and credit card accounts, brokerage, mutual funds, annuities, and trust and retirement funds, W-2, 1098, 1099MISC, 1099R, 1099B, 1099INT, 1099DIV and 1099OID tax reporting information, as applicable that will be made accessible by Financial Institution for importation Into the Intuit Products. 1.6 "Direct Connect” shall mean a method of connectivity of Financial Services with Intuit Products via a two-way server connection. 1.7 "Financial Services" shall mean the capability of Financial Institution customers to import their Data Into Intuit Products, send bill payment instructions through Intuit Products to Financial Institution, or transfer funds between accounts, as the case may be. 1.8 “Intuit Products" shall mean any web or desktop products or services, distributed under any name, e.g., intuit, Quicken, QuickBcoks, and any future versions or new products whether or not renamed or with the same name located at www.ti.lntuit.com as updated from time to time, and incorporated herein by reference. 1.9 "Link" shall mean a hypertext and/or graphical link, including a textual or framing link, from, for example, the Financial Institution site to the Intuit site or from the Intuit site to the Financial Institution site. 1.10 “Losses” shall mean direct losses, costs, claims, damages, settlement payments, attorneys' fees, liabilities, and penalties, court awards and other similar costs and expenses. 1.11 "Marks” shall mean the trademarks, service marks and distinct brand elements to be licensed, and the guidelines for use of such marks, as each party may provide the other from time to time under this Agreement. 1.12 “OFX" shall mean a Direct Connect or Web Connect system implemented by Fl to offer financial services to its customers that use that certain Open Financial Exchange specification (currently found at www.ofir.n6f), as such may be amended from time to time, that provides a unified technical specification for the electronic exchange of financial data between financial Institutions, business and consumers through the Internet. The method(s) of connectivity through Intuit Products described herein may not be comprehensive. Intuit reserves the right to add to or change such methods at its sole discretion, 1.13 “Online Banking” shall mean at a minimum, the retrieval of financial transactional and account balance Information for eligible accounts by an end user through the features of Intuit Products. It may also Include (if supported by Financial institution) inter-account fund transfers, and email to Financial Institution's designated customer service representative. 1.14 "Online Bill Payment" shall mean at a minimum, the electronic transmission of instructions for payment of bills and other obligations owed to third parties by an end user through the features of Intuit Products, it may also Include (if supported by Financial Institution) e-mail to Financial Institution's designated customer service representative, 1.15 “Online Investments” shall mean at a minimum, the retrieval of financial transactional and account balance Information for eligible accounts by an end user through the features of Intuit Products. It may also include (if supported by Financial Institution) Inter-account fund transfers, and email to Financial Institution’s designated customer service representative. ' 1.16 “Passport" shall mean the support package as further Identified in Schedule 4 ("Passport and DARTS Support"). 1.17 "Testing Services” shall mean the testing performed by intuit as described in Schedule 1 ("Testing Services”) and as may be posted and updated by Intuit from time to time at www.tiJntuh.com, and is incorporated herein by reference. 1.16 "Web Connect" shall mean a method of connectivity of Financial Services with Intuit Products via a one-way file download from the Financial Institution’s transactional web site using OFX. 2. GENERAL 2.1 Links. The parties agree to establish and maintain Links between the Financial Institution transactional web site and the Intuit site to enable Web Connect, and to provide information regarding the specifications of their respective sites and other technical assistance necessary to establish and maintain such Links. Maintenance of Links includes, but Is not limited to, periodic testing of the Links to ensure that they are functioning properly and notifying the other party of any changes in any URLs or other Information needed for continuous finking. This Section 2.1 is effective only In the event that Financial Institution chooses to participate in Web Connect. 2.2 Non-Exclusivltv. This Agreement is not exclusive on the part of any party hereto, and is not Intended to preclude or In any way restrict Financial institution or Intuit from promoting, advertising, displaying and offering or otherwise making available any products or services to their respective customers, potential customers or the general public, Including, but not limited to, products or services comparable to the Financial Services. 2.3 Marketing. Intuit will not solicit, e-mall, or contact any Financial institution customer In order to cross-sell Intuit products or services, provided however, that the foregoing restriction does not apply, (a) if a Financial Institution customer “opts in" to receive communications from Intuit, (b) If the Financial Institution customer is an existing Intuit customer, and (o) if the Financial institution customer signs up for other Intuit products or services. Financial institution acknowledges that Intuit may e-mail or contact Financial institution customers for the following reasons: (I) where such communication Is part of an automated messaging program (e.g. providing product updates); (II) to provide technical support; and (Hi) In circumstances where, In Intuit's sole discretion, an emergency requires Immediate communication to such customer. 2.4 intuit Products and Services. Intuit reserves the right to provide connectivity to additional products or services at Its sole discretion and without prior notification to Financial Institution, provided that Intuit provides primary customer support of such additional product or service. Intuit further reserves the right to add to, change, discontinue or, change the price of the products and services it offers from time to time, where such addition, change, discontinuation, or price change is generally applicable to its customers, upon sixty (60) days prior notice to Financial Institution. Intuit reserves the right to use a third party to host Its software applications and services from time to time. 3. OWNERSHIP RIGHTS. 3.1 Publicity. The parties to this Agreement shall not use the name of the other party in any press releases, marketing or sales materials, and promotional efforts or engage in other publicity without the prior written approval of the other party, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. Each party shall complete its review of any such materials or proposed activities within a reasonable time of Its receipt of such materials from the other party. 3.2 Ownership. Each party will retain al! right, title and Interest in and to Its respective Marks and Content worldwide, subject to the limited license granted to the other hereunder in connection with such party's performance of the Agreement. 3.3 Content and Trademark License. Each party hereby grants the other party a non-excluslve, worldwide, non-transferable, non- sublicensable, royalty-free and limited license to use its Content and Marks solely in connection with Its marketing and promotion obligations under the Agreement and solely during the term of this Agreement. Intult’a current guidelines for the use of its Intuit Products Marks are sat forth In the Trademark Guidelines posted on www.fl.fntuit.com as updated from time to time and incorporated herein by reference. Intuit shall notify Financial institution of any material change to the Trademark Guidelines. 4. FINANCIAL INSTITUTION OBLIGATIONS. 4.1 Implementation. Financial Institution agrees to Implement and operate, in a commercially reasonable manner, the online connection to the Financial Services features of the applicable Intuit Products (either by itself or through a third party). ■ 4.2 Operations. Financial Institution agrees that it will, or that It will cause its third party contractor or service bureau, which has signed an agreement with intuit to provide such an online connection on behalf of participants of the Marketing Program, to, use commercially reasonable efforts to provide customers using Financial Services the same or better server response times and server availability as it provides to Its customers who access Financial Institution's Financial Services by means other than Intuit Products. 4.3 Identification of Fees. Any fees charged by Financial Institution to customers related to this Agreement, shall be identified in such a way as to make It clear to the customer that the fee originates from the Financial Institution and not Intuit. 4.4 Marketing Program Participation and Fees. 4.4.1 Participation Feqs. Financial Institution shall pay to Intuit participation fees in accordance with Schedule 3 ("Pricing tor Marketing Program Participation"). Price Is based upon the following: (I) the participation period (as defined below), (II) Financial Institution's tier size (as defined herein), (Hi) Intuit Product choices by Financial Institution (as identified on the cover page of this Agreement), (iv) Marketing Program choice by Financial Institution (on the cover page of this Agreement), and (v) Schedule 1 (“Testing Services"). Intuit reserves the right to change any fees with sixty (80) days written notice prior to June 30th of any given year during the term of the Agreement 4.4.2 Participation Period. The first participation period under this Agreement shall be from the Effective Date of the Agreement through the next most recent July 31 ("First Participation Period"). By way of example only, if the Effective Date of the Agreement Is January 30, 2006, then the First Participation Period would be from January 30, 2006 through July 31,2006. Following the First Participation Period, an annual participation period is the time interval beginning August 1s* through July 31" (“Annual Participation Period"). 4.4.2.1 First Participation Period Fees, Invoicing and Payment. Intuit will Invoice Financial Institution and Financial Institution shall pay to Intuit one (1) full year fee, which shall not be prorated, shortly following the Agreement Effective Date (“First Participation Period Fee"). Such First Participation Period Fees shall ba payable only cnee, and shall be due and payable from Financial Institution to Intuit within thirty (30) days of Invoicing. 4.4.2.2 Annual Participation Period Fees, Invoicing and Payment. Intuit will Invoice Financial Institution and Financial Institution shall pay to Intuit, in advance, one (1) full year fee ("Annual Participation Period Fee"). Such Annual Participation Period Fee shall be due and payable from Financial Institution to Intuit on or before June 30th of each year for the next Annual Participation Period. Failure to timely pay the Annual Participation Period Fee may result in Financial Institution losing connectivity to end users utilizing Financial Services In the intuit Products. 4.4.3 Current Year. Intuit Product Versions. Financial institution Is required to support each new version of Intuit Products as they are released. 4.4.4 Prior Year Intuit. Product Version Fees. In the event Financial institution desires to connect to available prior year versions of Intuit Products, and unless otherwise stated in Schedule 3 (“Pricing for Marketing Program Participation"), Financial Institution shall pay to Intuit the applicable tier-based fee for each currently supported prior year version of the applicable Intuit Products made available through the Financial Services (“Prior Year Version Fees"). Intuit will invoice Financial Institution and Financial institution shall pay to Intuit such Prior Year Version Fees, which shall not be prorated, shortly following the Agreement Effective Date. Such Prior Year Version Fees shall be payable only once, and shall be due and payable from Financial Institution to Intuit within thirty (30) days of such invoicing. 4.4.5 Matins.Rrosiaa)—Efirtlgtoatlw.Change. Financial Institution shall have the option to discontinue participation In the Basic Marketing Program and switch to participation in the Premium or Premium Plus Marketing Program, with thirty (30) days prior written notice to Intuit of such change. Financial Institution agrees to pay to Intuit any Incremental program fees for such program participation change for the applicable year and thereafter according to the terms of this Agreement. Financial Institution shall have the option to discontinue participation in the Premium or Premium Pius Marketing Program and switch to participation In the Basic Marketing Program, with thirty (30) days prior written notice to Intuit of such change. Financial Institution agrees to pay to Intuit any incremental multiple Identities fees, as described herein, for the remainder of the Annual Participation Period (through the next July 31s1), according to the terms of this Agreement. Such multiple Identities fees are due and payable from Financial Institution to Intuit from the first day of such Program participation change and are not prorated. 4.4.6 Tier Size. A financial Institution’s tier size shall be based upon the combined assets and/or deposits of all financial institutions Included In an affiliated group of entitles in a multi-bank holding company. Each separate affiliated financial institution participating with one (1) or more Intuit Products shall be priced as listed In the Multiple Identities Fees Pricing Table in Schedule 3 ("Pricing for Marketing Program Participation"). Pursuant to Section 11.3 ("No Assignment"), below, In the event Financial Institution notifies Intuit of a merger or acquisition which results in a tier size change, Intuit will reassess Financial Institution's participation fees under this Agreement. In such event, notwithstanding any other provision in the Agreement to the contrary, the parties will execute a mutually agreed amendment to the Agreement if applicable, reflecting the new tier size, intuit will invoice Financial Institution and Financial Institution will pay to Intuit the applicable participation fees at the new tier rate. At a minimum, Intuit will assess Financial Institution's tier size annually prior to the annual invoice date. If Financial Institution or its multi-bank holding company has grown beyond the tier size as defined In the Agreement, whether organically or through merger or acquisition as described hereinabove, Intuit will invoice and Financial Institution will pay to Intuit the applicable new tier participation fees going forward. 4.4.7 Multiple Identities Fees. First Participation Period Fees, Annual Participation Period Fees, and Prior Year Version Fees are based upon no more than one (1) marketing identity per financial Institution. Any additional identities shall be priced the same as the primary financial Institution identity for First Participation Period Fees, Annual Participation Period Fees, and/or Prior Year Version Fees. An Identity, for purposes of clarification under this Agreement, is a unique financial institution name or the name of a business unit belonging to a financial institution as may be listed separately In the Intuit Products. Examples of separate Identities include; (I) separate investment account download entities (e.g., Private Banking, Investments, Trust); (li) separate credit card download Identities (e.g., ABC Credit Union - Credit Cards, Hometown Team Affinity Card); or (Hi) an acquired bank identity (e.g., if connected ‘‘Bank ABC" is acquired by Financial institution for any portion of any Participation Period as defined herein): (iv) separate Web Connect and Direct Connect Identities that are named differently even if targeting the same market segment (e.g., ABC Bank - Consumer [a Direct Connect Identity] and ABC Bank NetTeller |a Web Connect Identity]): or (v) an affiliated bank that is part of the same Multi-Bank Holding Company. Provided Financial Institution's server has passed OFX system functionality testing as described In Schedule 1 ('Testing Services") of the Agreement, Intuit agrees to: (a) display the Financial Institution's name, phone number, logo, URL and promotional messages, If any, in the Intuit Products in such locations and such manner as Intuit determines from time to time to provide such information generally to participants in the Premium Marketing Program or the Premium Plus Marketing Program for Intuit Products in which Financial Institution chooses to participate; and (b) display Financial Institution's URL In the list of participating financial institutions on www.Quicken.com through which the customer can access Financial Institution’s web site. Any changes to this information shall be provided to Intuit by use of the Quickinput form and such change will be implemented by Intuit within thirty (30) days after receipt of the changed Information, provided that If such change cannot be Implemented within the thirty (30) days, Intuit shall notify Financial Institution of the effective date for such change. 3. Pricing. For the right to participate in the Premium or Premium Plus Marketing Program described in this Schedule, Financial Institution agrees to pay the fees described on Schedule 3 ("Pricing for Marketing Program Participation") attached hereto and Incorporated herein by reference. Intuit 2632 Marine Way Mountain View, CA 94043 650.944.6000 www.intuit.coin I MTU IT. Intuit - OFX Connectivity Group Thank you for signing the Intuit Marketing Services Agreement As an Intuit partner, you now have access to all the information available on the password-protected side of our partner extranet, <http://fi.intuit.com>. The password-protected site provides detailed and confidential information about our products and services. * New Partner Toolbox Once logged on, feel free to explore the free downloads and other tools available in our New Partner Toolbox at fi.intuit.com (<http://fi.intuit.com/welcome/welcome kit.cfm>): Free Software for Intuit Partners Download the latest versions of Quicken and QuickBooks to expand the product knowledge and support capabilities of your customer support staff. In addition, browse through our product information section to become better acquainted with the new products and services you'll be offering your customers. We encourage you to learn more about exciting new features available in Quicken and QuickBooks. Template Promotional Messages Announce your new online capabilities to your customers. Use our templates, or create your own. You can also use Intuit product logos and box shots to add zip to your marketing copy. Please see our list of marketing materials & guidelines to determine how to effectively use the Intuit brand(s) to market to your customers. Getting Started Guides Help your customers get up and running with your new online services. We have provided these getting started guides for you to customize and include in your welcome kits, or post to your Web sites. Support & Training Tools Prepare to support Quicken and/or QuickBooks. Refer to our partner technical support section for the different resources Intuit has available to support our mutual customers. In addition. Intuit offers various levels of Quicken and QuickBooks training courses for our partners. All partners may attend one free Web-based training course of their choice. RovonooOpportuoi.ios The Intuit Affiliate Program is an exciting opportunity that allows you to provide a benefit to your customers as well as make money. You will be able to place Intuit product logos on your Web site and earn commissions by selling Intuit products. In addition, Quicken and QuickBooks present opportunities from within the software for Financial Institutions to reinforce brand awareness and cross-sell other services to Quicken/QuickBooks customers. We hope you find the above information helpful and useful. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us at quickinfo(a>intuit.com <mailto:quickinfo@intuit.com>. Quickinfo is our financial institution partner email address for general questions you may have for Intuit. Thank you, Quick Info Financial Institution Connectivity & Support *log in and passwords should have been sent to your primary contact by email, please email quickinfo@intuit.com if you did not receive this access info.

data.text: SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 INITIAL GLOBAL PLUS CUSTOMER This Services Addendum No. 4, executed as of August 17, 2018 (the “Services Addendum Effective Date”), by and between InvestEdge, Inc., with a mailing address at 1151 Freeport Road #396, Pittsburgh, PA 15238 (“InvestEdge”) and Fidelity Information Services, LLC, having a place of business at 601 Riverside Avenue, Jacksonville, FL 32204 (“Reseller” or “FIS”), is subject to the terms and conditions of the Master Reseller Agreement between InvestEdge and Reseller, dated as of September 28, 2011, as amended (collectively, the “Agreement”). Except as set forth herein, the terms of the Agreement will govern this Services Addendum No.4. Capitalized terms not otherwise defined in this Services Addendum No. 4 will have the meanings set forth in the Agreement. Intending to be legally bound, the Parties agree as follows: This Services Addendum No. 4 addresses the provision of the Standard GP Interface for a Customer (Chevy Chase) (the “Initial GP Customer”) using FIS’s proprietary Global Plus solution. Pursuant to a Statement of Work dated March 13, 2018, FIS and InvestEdge have developed a standard interface between FIS’ proprietary GlobalPlus Solution and InvestEdge’s proprietary Application Services (the “Standard GP Interface”). 1. Defined Terms. Any capitalized terms not defined herein shall have the meanings set forth in the Agreement. 2. Standard GP Interface. In the event that FIS determines that the Standard GP Interface should be updated or modified from time to time, the Parties will jointly support the Standard GP Interface by maintaining their respective solutions as necessary for Reseller and InvestEdge to transmit/receive Customer data under this Services Addendum No. 4 for the Initial GP Customer. 3. Application Services. The “Client Reporting Services” functionality provides the ability to run reports that contain Account performance, holdings and transaction information as provided through Customer data feeds. Customers can create packages of reports, modify report parameters, and run report packages ad-hoc or on a scheduled basis using Customer-designated frequencies and delivery options for print and mailing fulfillment. Note that certain reports require third party data subscriptions. 4. Third Party Ancillary Products (a) Morningstar Data Feed Services The “Morningstar Data Feed Services” functionality includes the loading of Morningstar Mutual Fund and Equity data into the InvestEdge system to be used by Customers subscribing to the Application Services pursuant to the terms set forth on Exhibit B. which is attached hereto and made a part hereof. (b) S&P Index Data The “S&P Index Data” service provides daily performance returns and sector weightings for the indexes below to be used by Customers subscribing to the Application Services for stock sector attribution reporting and comparisons on performance reports. I SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 INITIAL GLOBAL PLUS CUSTOMER • S&P 500 and sector level indices • S&P 400 and sector level indices • S&P 600 and sector level indices • S&P Composite 1500 and sector level indices • S&P 100 (no sector level indices) S&P 500 Equal Weighted and sector level indices 5. Term. The term of this Services Addendum No. 4 will commence on the Services Addendum Effective Date and will end upon the earlier of: (i) expiration of the Initial Customer’s Subscription Term, (ii) expiration or termination of the agreement between FIS and the Initial GP Customer for the Global Plus solution or (ii) expiration or termination of the Agreement, in accordance with Section 13 of the Agreement. The subscription for the Initial Customer shall begin on October 3 I, 2018 or as mutually agreed upon and continue for an initial period of two (2) years and renew thereafter for successive one (1) year periods unless Reseller provides termination notice within 60 days of the expiration of the initial period or the renewal period (collectively, the “Subscription Term”). 6. Fees. (a) Application Services Reseller will pay InvestEdge a I/I2111 portion of the Annual Service Fee on a monthly basis for the Initial Customer Account using the Client Reporting Services in accordance with this Section 7. Accounts Annual Service Fee 0-25,000 $18.00 25,001 -50,000 $17.00 50,001 - 75,000 $16.00 75,001 - 100,000 $15.00 100,001 + $12.00 Example: If Client A has 10,000 accounts using the service, Client B has 20,000 accounts using the service and Client C has 23,000 accounts using the service, the annual Client Reporting services fees to be paid to InvestEdge by FIS would be $923,000 (25,000 accts x $18 per account plus 25,000 accts x $17 per account plus 3,000 accts x $16 per account). Account Minimum InvestEdge will charge Reseller an initial minimum Annual Service Fee for each Customer (“Annual Minimum Fee”). InvestEdge will charge Reseller an Annual Minimum Fee that is equal to the per-Account Annual Service Fee for a minimum of 1,000 Accounts. Reseller will not be charged any incremental per-Account Annual Service Fees for a Customer until the number of Accounts loaded for that Customer exceeds 1,000 Accounts. Example: Customer A has 800 Accounts, Reseller would be charged an Annual Service Fee for Customer B of $18,000 (1000 Accounts x $18 per Account, assuming the total accounts using the 2 SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 INITIAL GLOBAL PLUS CUSTOMER Application Services is less than or equal to 25,000). Two months later, 1,200 Accounts are loaded for Customer A. Reseller would then be charged an Annual Service Fee for Customer A of $21,600 (1200 Accounts x $18 per Account). Customer Subscription Termination Should a Customer discontinue use of the Application Services prior to the end of the Subscription Term, Reseller shall pay InvestEdge 80% of Annual Service Fees due for the remaining Subscription Term. Example: Client A subscribes for the Application Services for 5 years. After the 3rd anniversary of the subscription, Client A has 3,500 account using the Application Services and discontinues use of the Application Services. Reseller would pay InvestEdge $100,800 (3,500 accounts x $18/acct x 2 years remaining on the subscription x .80). (b) Third Party Ancillary Services MorningStar Data InvestEdge will charge FIS an annual fee of $15,000 per Customer subscription S&P Index Data InvestEdge will charge FIS an annual fee of $5,000 per Customer subscription (c) Professional Services Unless otherwise agreed in a particular SOW, Reseller will pay InvestEdge for Professional Services at the hourly rate of $200.00 (‘'Professional Services Rate”) for Professional Services, with the exception of report development. Reseller will pay InvestEdge an hourly rate of $150.00 for report development (“Reporting Professional Services Rate”). (d) Fee Increases InvestEdge may increase Annual Service Fees for the Application Services once annually commencing on the second anniversary of the Services Addendum Effective Date. InvestEdge will determine any percentage increase at its sole discretion; however, InvestEdge will not increase Annual Service Fees for the Application Services by more than 3% annually. 7. Roles and Responsibilities. (a) Interface Support InvestEdge Responsibilities • Implement and maintain the infrastructure needed to support the daily receipt, transformation and load of the standard interface files. • Upgrade InvestEdge integration software to accommodate any GlobalPlus accounting system maintenance 3 SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 INITIAL GLOBAL PLUS CUSTOMER Reseller Responsibilities • Assist Initial GP Customer and with the proper coding of client accounts for inclusion in the standard interface files • Provide Initial GP Customer data on a timely basis in a format with content necessary to enable the Client Reporting Services functionality, including updates to transactions, positions, and security master data. • Provide InvestEdge with daily data from a demo site to support sales demonstrations. • Provide InvestEdge with pertinent release notes for proper handling of incremental Standard GP Interface file changes. (b) Customer Support Customer Responsibilities: • Assign Customer support resources to: o Manage user functional and account entitlements o Resolve user log on problems o Provide user error assistance o Execute system administration functions o Answer user questions relating to the access, usage, configuration, features, functions and functionality of the Application Services. • Engage InvestEdge for assistance with user questions that Customer support resources cannot answer by opening a ticket in the InvestEdge web-based incident management system, including a description of the steps to recreate the issue, relevant screenshots of the user experience, and a description of the expected behavior. • Designate a single point of contact to prioritize issues for, and coordinate any follow  up required with, the InvestEdge support team • Investigation and resolution of user questions related to Customer third party data or Customer provided data loaded to the Application Services • Provide technical resources to support escalations to InvestEdge related to data issues arising from Customer third party data or Customer provided data. • Participate in validation activities for periodic Application Services software updates. InvestEdge Responsibilities • Provide Customer users access to the InvestEdge Help Center, an online Application Services documentation repository • Resolution of Customer questions submitted through the InvestEdge web-based incident management system relating to the access, usage, configuration, features, functions and functionality of the Application Services. • Error re-creation, correction and workaround support for malfunctions or deficiencies in the operation of the Application Services • Resolution of issues under InvestEdge’s control that involve system unavailability, Dataloads, and hosting/hardware, communications • Resolution of data issues under the control of InvestEdge (InvestEdge third party data providers such as Morningstar, etc.) InvestEdge is not responsible for providing Customer support to the extent an issue relates to or results from the following: 4 SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 INITIAL GLOBAL PLUS CUSTOMER • Customer use of browsers other than: o The two most recently available commercial versions of Internet Explorer o The most recently commercially available version of Firefox o The most recently commercially available version of Chrome o The most recently commercially available version of Safari • Customer’s desktop installation does not include Adobe Reader • Customer use of screen resolutions other than 1024 x 768 • Customers exceeding the following system performance limits: o 15,000 maximum Customer Accounts per user profile o 1,000 reports in report packages o 1,000 Customer Accounts in a consolidated account Reseller Responsibilities • Provide Customer relationship contacts at Reseller for each Customer in support joint escalation activities • Provide annual upgrade schedule per client for Global Plus 8. Implementation. The implementation of the Standard GP Interface for the Initial GP Customer (the “Initial Implementation”) have been agreed to pursuant to the SOW dated March 13, 2018. 9. Additional Terms and Conditions The Standard GP Interface is proprietary to FIS and under no circumstances will InvestEdge have a right to market, license, sell, resell or distribute the FIS proprietary Standard GP Interface, if and until such time that FIS and InvestEdge have entered into a separate referral / joint marketing agreement to do so. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Services Addendum No. 4 as of the Addendum Effective Date. INVESTEDGE, INCy /) By: <3  Name:   Title:   Name: Faby Severin Title: Sr. Global Procurement Contract Manager 5 EXHIBIT A TO SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 Application Services Subscription Form Services Addendum No. 4 Global Plus Customer Subscription Form Global Plus Customer Name Chevy Chase   Reseller Contact Information  Global Plus Customer Account/Relationship Manager Jud Stone Phone# 850.460.1847 Email Jud.stone@fisglobal.com   Customer Contact Information  Name/Title Lynn M. Panagos SENIOR MANAGING DIRECTOR TEL 240.497.5048 7501 Wisconsin Avenue, Suite I500W Bethesda, Maryland 20814 lpanagos@chevychasetrust.com Time Zone Applicable to Customer (Select One) ET CT MT PT   Implementation and Application Services Information  Service Subscription Effective Date (Go-Live) October 31, 2018 Target Date for Initial Interface File Delivery August 31, 2018 (or another date as mutually agreed upon) Number of Accounts 5000 Subscription Expiration Date (Not less than 3 years from Effective Date) June 30, 2025   Third Party Ancillary' Product Subscriptions  Morningstar Data Feed No S&P Index Data Feed No             Reseller By: Name: Faby Severin Date: 08 / 21 / 2018 1 EXHIBIT A TO SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 Application Services Subscription Form Services Addendum No. 4 Acknowledgement of Global Plus Customer Subscription InvestEdge hereby acknowledges receipt of the Subscription Form dated, 20 for the  following Customer under the following Services Addendum: Services Addendum No.: 4 Customer: CHEVY CHASE TRUST COMPANY Reseller and InvestEdge have agreed upon the following for this Global Plus Customer: Production Date (Subscription Effective Date): Subscription Term: Additional Information: InvestEdge, Inc. By:   Name:   Date: //    2 EXHIBIT B TO SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 Additional Terms Applicable to Morningstar Data Feeds This Exhibit sets forth the terms and conditions governing the provision by InvestEdge to Reseller of certain Morningstar, Inc. (“Morningstar”) data feeds. The services identified in this Exhibit constitute “Third Party Ancillary Products” within the meaning of Section 2.9 of the Agreement. 1. Morningstar Data; End User Agreements. InvestEdge will make available to Reseller the Morningstar data feeds comprised of the standard data points regarding various mutual funds, bonds, stocks, and other financial instruments set forth on Appendix A hereto (the “Morningstar Data”) via the Internet or a private network connection for re-distribution to Customers on InvestEdge’s behalf. The fees for the Morningstar Data are set forth in Section 7 of Services Addendum No. 4. Each End User Agreement must contain terms substantially similar to those set forth in Articles 4 and 5 and Sections 3.2, 3.3, 3.4, 7.1 and 7.2 of this Exhibit. 2. Fee Schedule for Morningstar Data Feeds. Reseller will pay to InvestEdge an annual fee set forth in Section 7 of Services Addendum No. 4 for each Customer (the “Morningstar Fee”) for the Morningstar Data, provided that such amount may be revised from time to time. InvestEdge w ill include a pro rata portion of the Morningstar Fee as a separate line item on the March, June, September and December invoices provided by InvestEdge to Reseller pursuant to Section 4.3 of the Agreement. 3. License for Morningstar Data Feeds; Ownership. 3.1 License to Reseller. InvestEdge hereby grants Reseller a limited, non-exclusive, non- transferable license to redistribute Application Services containing Morningstar Data solely to Customers on behalf of InvestEdge. Reseller acknowledges that Reseller will not have access to the Morningstar Data itself, and will have no usage rights in any way to the Morningstar Data except as set forth in this Exhibit; provided, however, that Reseller may access, display and use the Application Services containing the Morningstar Data for demonstration purposes. 3.2 License to Customers. Reseller will grant to its Customers an English-only, non-exclusive, non-transferable, limited license for the number of Customer employees set forth in each applicable End User Agreement and communicated to InvestEdge in writing who are financial advisors, portfolio managers, investment counselors or are in other similar job positions to use the Morningstar Data solely for internal purposes. Such use rights include the right to incorporate insubstantial portions of the Morningstar Data in reports (“Reports”) made available to end users of Reseller’s Customers for their personal, non-commercial use. 3.3 Ownership. InvestEdge and its licensor, Morningstar, will have and retain all right, title, and interest in and to the Morningstar Data, including, without limitation, any intellectual property of Morningstar contained therein. 3.4 Termination. The license for the Morningstar Data set forth in this Section 3 will terminate automatically and immediately at any time upon the termination of InvestEdge’s license of the Morningstar Data from Morningstar for any reason. In case of any such termination, InvestEdge will refund to Reseller without interest a pro rata portion of the prepaid but unaccrued Morningstar Fee. 4. Attribution and Limitations. 4.1 Morningstar Information. Certain of the information contained in the Morningstar Data: (a) is proprietary to Morningstar and/or its content providers; (b) may not be copied or distributed; and (c) is not warranted to be accurate, complete or timely. None of InvestEdge, Morningstar nor its content providers is responsible for any damages or losses arising from any use of this information. 4.2 Attribution. If Reseller or its Customers displays all or any portion of the Morningstar Data, Reseller will include, and will obligate the Customers to include, in a prominent place and not alter any indicia of ownership or d isclaimer(s) provided by Morningstar. If the applicable EXHIBIT B TO SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 Additional Terms Applicable to Morningstar Data Feeds disclaimer language is already embedded in the portion of the Morningstar Data being displayed by Reseller or Customer, Reseller and Customer do not have to include redundant disclaimer language but will ensure that any such disclaimer language is not removed from the Morningstar Data by Customers, Reseller or its agents. 4.3 License Limitations. Reseller will not, and will obligate the Customers to not, use the Morningstar Data, any derivation of the name '’Morningstar” or any intellectual property of Morningstar in any advertising or marketing materials or issue any public communication related to this Exhibit. Reseller will not, and will obligate the Customers to not, make any enhancement or modification to, or derivative works of, the Morningstar Data, except with respect to its permitted use in Reports. Except to the extent expressly provided for in Section 3 above, Reseller may not, and will obligate the Customers to not: (a) sublicense, publish, transmit, transfer, sell, reproduce, distribute, display, alter or in any way exploit the Morningstar Data; (b) combine, mix or integrate the Morningstar Data with the Morningstar Data of any other suppliers in a manner that makes attribution of the Morningstar Data to Morningstar unclear; (c) use the Morningstar Data outside of the territories of the United States; or (d) charge a licensing fee or similar fee for providing any portion of the Morningstar Data or any output from it to a third party. 4.4 Breaches of the Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, any breach by Reseller of this Exhibit will constitute a breach by Reseller of the Agreement for purposes of Section 13.2 thereof. 5. Inapplicability of Exhibit B of the Agreement; Disclaimer of Warranty. Reseller acknowledges that InvestEdge is entirely dependent upon Morningstar with respect to the availability, accuracy and completeness of the Morningstar Data. Therefore, none of the service availability commitments, remedies, or related provisions set forth in Services Addendum No. 4 to the Agreement will apply to the Morningstar Data. If Reseller informs InvestEdge of any defect in the Morningstar Data, InvestEdge will employ commercially reasonable efforts to have Morningstar promptly remedy such defect. INVESTEDGE AND MORNINGSTAR DO NOT GUARANTEE THE ACCURACY, INTEGRITY, COMPLETENESS OR TIMELINESS OF THE MORNINGSTAR DATA. THE MORNINGSTAR DATA IS PROVIDED “AS IS,” WITH ALL FAULTS AND THE ENTIRE RISK AS TO SATISFACTORY QUALITY, PERFORMANCE, ACCURACY AND EFFORT IS WITH THE RESELLER. INVESTEDGE AND MORNINGSTAR DISCLAIM ALL OTHER WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, (A) ABSENCE OF VIRUSES AND DAMAGING OR DISABLING CODE, (B) ANY WARRANTIES OR REPRESENTATIONS THAT (i) THE MORNINGSTAR DATA WILL BE ERROR- FREE OR THAT ACCESS THERETO WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, (ii) THE MORNINGSTAR DATA OR ANY PORTION OF IT IS COMPATIBLE WITH ANY PARTICULAR COMPUTER SOFTWARE OR PLATFORM, OR (iii) THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OR CONDTIONS OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FORA PARTICULAR PURPOSE, ACCURACY OF INFORMATIONAL CONTENT, NONINFRINGEMENT OR ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES ARISING FROM COURSE OF DEALING OR COURSE OF PERFORMANCE. 6. Applicability of Terms and Conditions of the Agreement. Except to the extent expressly provided otherwise in this Exhibit, InvestEdge’s provision of the Morningstar Data to Reseller will be subject to all of the terms and conditions of the Agreement. The terms and conditions of this Exhibit will govern and control with respect to the provision of the Morningstar Data in the event of any conflict with the terms and conditions of the Agreement. 7. Term; Effects of Termination. 7.1 Term. This Exhibit will commence on the Service Addendum Effective Date and have a one-year term ending on each anniversary of the 2 EXHIBIT B TO SERVICES ADDENDUM NO. 4 Additional Terms Applicable to Morningstar Data Feeds Service Addendum Effective Date, provided that it will automatically renew for an unlimited number of additional one-year terms unless either party provides written notice to the other party of its desire to terminate this Exhibit at least 30 days before the expiration of the initial term or any subsequent three-year renewal term. This Exhibit will automatically terminate upon the first to terminate of Services Addendum No. 4 or the Agreement. 7.2 Effect of Termination, if this Exhibit terminates for any reason, Reseller will, and will cause its Customers to, immediately cease to use the Morningstar Data and will destroy all copies thereof (in any form or media) within Reseller’s or its Customer’s possession, custody or control. 7.3 Termination Right. Either party may terminate this Exhibit upon 120 days’ prior written notice to the other. 3 Appendix A Morningstar Data • Fact Sheet Package for Open End Mutual Funds, Exchange Traded Funds, Closed End Funds • Performance and Extended Performance Package for Open End Mutual Funds • Equity Daily Performance Feed • Equity Monthly Warehouse Feed

data.text: AMENDMENT TO MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT #5002 BY AND BETWEEN FIDELITY INFORMATION SERVICES, LLC ("CUSTOMER") AND LASALLE SYSTEMS LEASING, INC. ("RESELLER") This Amendment is entered into this 7th day of June 2019, between LaSalle Systems Leasing, Inc., an Illinois corporation, having its principal place of business at 9550 W Higgins Road, Rosemont, IL 60018 ("Reseller") and FIDELITY INFORMATION SERVICES, LLC having its principal place of business at 601 Riverside Ave., Jacksonville, FL 32204 ("Customer"). WITN E SSETH: WHEREAS, Reseller and Customer entered into Master Services Agreement #5002 on August 10, 2007 (the "Agreement") and Amendment on April 1, 2014. This Amendment has an “effective date" of June 7, 2019 WHEREAS, Reseller and Customer desire to amend this Agreement. NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises herein contained, the parties hereby agree as follows: 1. Reseller and Customer desire to and do herein specifically confirm their continued performance of the Agreement. The term of the Agreement shall continue through December 31, 2023 2. The parties agree that Exhibit I and Exhibit II inthe Addendum A, dated December 1st, 2014, between the parties, are hereby deleted and replaced in their entirety by the attached Exhibit I and Exhibit II in this Amendment. 3. In consideration of executing this Amendment, the parties agree that, as of the effective date of this Amendment, Customer shall be entitled to receive a one-time cash payment of an estimated $1,200,000 (“One-Time Payment") that is provided for in Exhibit II attached hereto. The One-Time Payment shall be paid to Customer by Cisco Capital as soon as Cisco Capital completes a final tax value calculation. 4. In all other respects, the Agreement shall remain unchanged and in full force and effect.
