data.text: Executive Summary Lucent September 4th, 2007 Brent Wilder Brian Germundson Wayne Dake Brian Breitzmann Jim Andracchi Ken Weyek I. Overview The current IP Management system, while able to manage the current infrastructure, does not have additional tools and capabilities to move Metavante into the future. We have about 1,200 IP addresses available to manage which means that we can only add 1,200 devices to our network before we reach our capacity. This will cause problems as our company continues to grow. Additional IP addresses can be purchased but our current version does not allow for proper management of the addresses. This proposal will upgrade our management systems with a more robust and manageable version to allow us to perform the management process more efficiently. For more detail please see investment proposal NWS195-07. II. Agreement Summary 1) Tenn/Pricing: Tiered license pricing, fixed for six years. Support pricing based on 15% of net license fee paid, with annual increases not to exceed 5% versus existing 15% of list price per license. 3) IP Address Licensing terms: Metavante has the right to burst above the actual licensed IP Addresses ( up to 20% of the base ) at no-charge, however Lucent has the right to audit twice per year ( January and June ) to determine the actual number of IP Addresses deployed. If Metavante has more IP Addresses deployed than licensed, then Metavante is obligated to purchase the net number of licenses actually deployed above the base. 4) IP Classic versus Active. Lucent grants Metavante the right to convert all Classic IP Addresses to Active IP Addresses, at no-charge ( Si0,000 value ). 5) Audit Manager software is provided at no-charge for the first 35,000 existing licenses ( $8,400 value ). 5) IP Address license fee reduction ( Classic Comparison ): 40,000 IP Address Order in 2002: $ 1.65 each Current order of Additional 65,000 IP Addresses: $0.93 each 43% reduction in price. ( see attached 2002 Lucent invoice ) 5) Product Acceptance: Not required. HI. License Buffer Conditions: Definitions Maintenance Year: The twelve-month period in which Software support service “Support and Subscription Services” are provided to Customer by ALU. The Support and Subscription Service will be provided in accordance with ALU’s then current offering and are renewable each year and must be paid-up annually in advance. Buffer Object Count (“Buffer”): The number of Objects Customer has been granted a conditional and temporary but renewable right to use above the number of licenses that were paid for on or about the previous year’s 12-Month anniversary of the “Maintenance Year”. Actual Use Object Count: The number of Objects counted as a result of the object count script described herein (Baseline is 50,000 Classic or 35,000 Active) Scope of Agreement As of the effective date of this agreement, Customer has paid for the right to use, 50,000 Classic or 35,000 Active Object Licenses (Paid-Up Licenses). However, Customerjias requested that it be granted a right to use a “Buffer” of Licenses above the number of Licenses for which it has paid. Customer wishes to be charged a right to use fee and a maintenance fee according the number of Licenses it has placed in Actual Use and accordingly retain a “Buffer” of Licenses. In consideration for mutual promises set forth /sht 7/796 c ifiles/form s/m esa.doc herein, ALU agrees to grant Customer a TERM LICENSE to use a “Buffer” of Licenses in combination with Customer’s Paid-up Licenses according to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement. Customer may use all licenses granted (either by grant of Term License or by grant of Perpetual License) on a single server or on multiple servers so long as the license granted is not exceeded. TERM LICENSE: Under the conditions set forth herein, Customer is granted a TERM LICENSE to use 20% over the amount of Paid-up licenses. The TERM LICENSE consists of a combination of a “Buffer” count of Objects which are not in “actual use” and the actual number of Customer paid-up right to use licenses for objects. The duration of the TERM LICENSE is twelve (12) months commencing January 1st and ending December 31st. Except for the duration of the License granted, all other terms and conditions of the controlling agreement apply to this grant. ALU will issue a “temporary key” which will enable the Licenses and the Buffer (20% over the Actual Use Audit Count) described herein for the 12-Month Term. This “temporary key” must be renewed in accordance with this agreement if Customer wishes to continue to use the TERM Licenses and the Buffer past the date of expiration of the “temporary key”. As of the effective date of this agreement, the Buffer is: QIP license “right to use” 20% over and above the Paid-Up licenses and modules for 12 months commencing January 1st and ending December 31st. Upon issuance of “Buffer” temporary key by ALU, Customer agrees to destroy all QIP license keys in its possession or control that exceed the Paid-up licenses plus the 20% Buffer. ' TERM LICENSE RENEWAL: Customer may qualify to be granted additional 12 Months use of the Licenses and the Buffer described above for the term of the Agreement. If Customer follows the steps outlined below, an additional 12-Month Term License identical to the grant described herein shall be granted to Customer. A. QIP OBJECT COUNT AUDIT Customer agrees to use the 50,000 Classic or 35,000 Active IP Addresses (Paid-up Licenses) as an initial Baseline and agrees to a minimum yearly maintenance fee based upon the pricing for Support and Subscription as set forth herein. Customer further agrees to accurately represent the number of Objects it is actually using over and above the Baseline and to pay for additional Licenses it has placed in Actual Use and is using and for software support and Subscription of all Licenses. To audit Customer’s representations, twice during the Maintenance Year (once at renewal of the Support and Subscription Services at the commencement of the maintenance year and once again during the following six-months of the maintenance year) ALU’s Support Center will contact Customer to obtain Customer’s actual “Object Count”. Customer will run a “QIP Object Count Audit Script” (Script that will calculate the number of active objects.) The Script will be provided by the ALU Support Center. The total figure generated by the Script is the number of objects requiring a License to use. (Actual Count of Objects) If Customer has not already purchased the additional right to use Licenses over the baseline (“N” below) then Customer is responsible for purchasing the additional RTU’s and associated support and /sht 7/Z96 c: fi I e s/fo rnis/m es a. d oc subscription. For the mid year Audit any additional maintenance payments will be pro-rated. If there is a new license, at any time during any fiscal your, ALU will issue a new Term License key, for balance of the term. B. FEES: CALCULATION Upon each audit, Customer agrees to pay Fees for both RTU and Maintenance for Licenses based upon the number of Licenses actually being used over the previous audit count Baseline (Actual Count of Objects) which may be revealed after the QIP Object Count Audit Script is run. Calculation of charges is based on formula: Q-B = N: “Q” = Result of running the QIP OBJECT COUNT AUDIT SCRIPT “B” = The Baseline- derived from counting total Paid-up Licenses each year starting with 50,000 Classic or 35,000 Active upon execution of this agreement. “N” = Number of Licenses which must be purchased TERMINATION OF TERM LICENSE Without Cause: In the event that Customer wishes to discontinue renewal of the TERM LICENSE under the conditions described herein, Customer shall retain,the right to use the number of Paid-Up DHCP Objects in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Customer will not be granted a right to use the “Buffer”. FOR CAUSE: ALU may immediately terminate the TERM LICENSE for the Buffer if Customer fails to perform the QIP AUDIT or any of its material obligations under this Agreement and such failure is not corrected within thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice of the breach thereof from the ALU. The terms and conditions attached hereto as Attachment A shall govern this SOW. To be eligible for RTS-A service, all software for which the service is purchased must be at the most current generally available revision level. Tire right-to-use (RTU) license and any associated hardware upgrades (if required) Tor obtaining the most current generally available revision level is not included in RTS-A service. The customer for the service (“Customer”) is responsible for separately purchasing any additional hardware or software to gel to the current release if required for an upgrade, 1. TERM The word “Term” includes the Initial Term and any Renewal Terms, as defined herein. The “Initial Term” will begin dh the day the purchase order for the RTS-A is accepted unless otherwise agreed in writing and will continue for one year. RTS-A may be renewed for successive calendar year terms (each a “Renewal Term”) upon written agreement of die parties. 2. SUPPORT LEVELS RTS-A is offered at four Support Levels, Standard (8x5), Global Standard (8X5), Premium (7x24) and Global Premium (7X24). Standard Support in-hours provides access to remote engineers in the 8AM-5PM time zone corresponding to Customer's address listed on the Order. Monday-Friday, excluding ALU holidays. For Standard Support, out-of-hours (OOH) support for a Severity 1 outage will be provided on a reasonable efforts basis. Severity Level 2-4 support will be provided on an as-available basis. Global Standard support prorides the same level of support as Standard except SAM-5PM time zone corresponds to the geographic location where product is installed. Premium Support prorides access to remote engineers 24 hours a day, 7 days a week for Severity 1 and 2 issues. Severity 3 & 4 issues can be submitted ria phone or on-line 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, but will be addressed by a remoie engineer during Standard support in-hours. For Premium Support, OOH support for Severity 3 & 4 issues will be provided on an as-available basis. Global Premium support prorides the same level of support as Premium except Standard support in-hours corresponds to the geographic location where product is installed. Customer’s Support Level is as indicated on the SOA. The Customer’s default Support Level shall be Standard. Customer may elect to change its Support Level to a lower level than originally purchased at the end of the Initial Term or any Renewal Term by proriding ALU with written notice al least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the then-current term of Customer’s election to change its Maintenance Support Level. Customer may elect to move from the Standard Support Level to the Premium Support Level at any time upon notice to ALU and by paying the difference in the fees associated with such Support Level change. 3. ALU RESPONSIBILITIES ALU will provided the following services during the Term: 3.1 REMOTE TECHNICAL SUPPORT (RTS) RTS is provided during the applicable coverage period as defined above to respond to Customer’s calls and Web- submitted requests for assistance (Assistance Request or “AR”). An AR will be considered valid when ALU confirms its acknowledgement by providing Customer with an AR tracking number. ALU will acknowledge receipt of a reported AR during the applicable coverage period in accordance with lhe Respond time objectives set forth in Section 3.4 and provide Customer with an AR tracking number. ALU will troubleshoot system problems down io a Maintained Product component level, or sufficiently to exclude Maintained Products as the root cause, ria phone or modem connection. As part of this process, ALU will help identify and support Customer implementation of eligible Software Patches or Software Updates for Maintained Products. Further, ALU will verify customer-detected problems, provided that the problem can be recreated with an unmodified release of tlie Maintained Products. Following verification of the problem, ALU will restore Maintained Products to operational status by providing a software fix and/or procedural workaround, when feasible. 3.2 DEFINITION OF SEVERITY LEVELS Severity Levels are defined as lhe condition of the Maintained Product when Customer submits an AR. ALU reserves the right to assign a higher or lower Severity Level to a problem once it has verified the problem. Severity Level 1 (Critical): The Maintained Product is inoperative and Customer’s inability to use the product has a critical effect on Customer’s operations. This condition is generally characterized by complete system failure and requires immediate correction. In addition, any condition that may critically impact human safety is considered a Severity Level I problem. Severity Level 2 (Major): The  Maintained Product is partially inoperative but still usable by Customer. The inoperative portion of the product severely restricts Customer’s operations, but has a less critical effect than a Severity Level 1 condition. Severity Level 3 (Minor): The Maintained Product is usable by Customer, but with limited functions. This condition is not critical and docs not severely restrict Customer’s overall operations. Severity Level 4 (Minor): The Maintained Product is usable and the condition docs not materially affect Customer’s operations. Customer suggestions for future improvements are not covered under RTS-A service. 3.3 DEFINITION OF RESPOND, RESTORE, AND RESOLVE RESPOND means a ALU Customer Support Engineer has contacted Customer regarding a particular AR. In the event ALU is unable to contact Customer after three (3) attempts, the AR will be closed; RESTORE means that the problem is remedied sufficiently to return the product or major feature to operational status. Restore may mean that a temporary fix has been provided to temporarily correct the problem, or that a workaround has been implemented, or a method of restoration has been made available to Customer; RESOLVE means that a solution has been provided to address the issue. This may occur simultaneously with Restore, unless the Restore is by means of a workaround suitable only for temporary use and ALU determines that a more suitable permanent solution can feasibly be provided. 3.4 RTS PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES v.010506 Confidential Call Receipt and Routing: for Standard and Premium Coverage is 24X7. The Response time objective for Standard and Premium Coverage for Severity Levels 1 & 2 - 20 minutes: Severity Levels 3 & 4 (In-Hours) - 60 minutes; Severity Levels 3 & 4 (Out-of-Hours) - Next Business Day. The Restore time objectives are as follows: Severity Level 1 - 24 hours; Severity Level 2-72 hours. The Resolve time objectives arc as follows: Severity Levels 1 & 2 (Non-design Change) - 30 calendar days: Severity Levels 3 & 4 (Non-design Change) - 60 calendar days; Severity Levels 1-4. (Design Change) - 180 calendar days. Nori-design Change means changes not requiring a Design Change or development of software code. Design Change means a change in design or development of software code is required, and where ALU elects, based upon its assessment of leclinical and economic feasibility, and subject to the applicable software support policy for the software in question to undertake the same. Add 15 minutes to all performance objectives for ARs submitted via the web. Matters attributable to 3rd party products have performance objectives provided by the 3rd party product and are excluded from Ute metrics above 3.5 WEB- BASED SUPPORT ALU will also proride Customer 24x7 access to the applicable '"Customer Support” content of the ALU.com Web site(s) ("ALU.com") which may include technical product support information, subscription sendees, and other self  help facilities, as well as the ability to submit and status ARs online. ALU.com is used to deliver certain items described below in the Software Maintenance section of this SOW. Customer shall not enable or permit access to any person other than its employees and the employees of its agents, consultants, and contractors who need to use ALU.com for the operation, administration, and management of their duties for Customer in accordance with the terms of this SOW. Customer shall identify to ALU any non-employce who will be given access. ALU may deny access immediately and in the future to individuals using ALU.com other than as permitted. ALU shall have no liability to Customer resulting from such denial. 4. SOFTWARE MAINTENANCE The following software maintenance items are provided under RTS-A: 4.1 Software Patches/Software Updates Software Patches are minor modifications to the Maintained Product to address a specific problem and help restore a Maintained Product. Software Updates are a collection of Software Patches and are sometimes referred to as maintenance releases. Software Updates are generally downloaded via an electronic interface and do not contain any new or additional features beyond what was provided in Customer’s current software release 4.2 Software Upgrades Software Upgrades are releases making more substantial changes than Software Updates. Software Upgrades may contain new features or the addition of enhanced functionality to current products. Any Software Upgrades that may be provided by ALU under the RTS-A service are provided as available, except for those Maintained Products for which the SOA indicates Software Upgrades are not included. ALU does not commit that any Software Upgrades will ultimately be released, made generally available and therefore provided during the Term. Furthermore, ALU does not warrant that any specific features or functionality will be included in any Software Upgrades that may be provided. 4.3 License Terms All software that is ultimately provided in connection with RTS-A service, including without limitation Software Updates, Software Upgrades, Software Patches or workarounds, is licensed subject to die same terms, restrictions, and limitations as contained in the licenses under which die original software was acquired. 5. DISCONTINUED AVAILABILITY AND VERSION SUPPORT The term “Version” as used in this SOW refers to Software Updates as well as Software Upgrades. Beginning on the day Customer has installed (loaded onto a computer) a new Version, ALU will support both the old Version and new Version concurrently for 90 days. Upon completion of the installation of Software Update or Software Upgrade, Customer agrees to destroy the original and all copies of the previous Versions, which are in Customer’s possession or control within 90 days and, if requested, certify such destruction to ALU. In case of discontinued availability (“DA”) of any Maintained Product or Version, RTS will continue to be available, subject to the terms of this SOW, for such Maintained Product or Version for the period stated in a DA notification provided to Customer, which period shall not be less than 12 months from the date of the DA notification [or such other period required under the terms of the agreement pursuant to which the Maintained Product was originally acquired from ALUJ (“the Transition Period”). Any renewal of the Term of this SOW shall apply to such products only through die cud of the Transition Period, and charges relating to such products in any Renewal Term invoice will be pro  rated accordingly. 6. EXCLUSIONS The following are excluded from RTS-A but may be ordered separately on a time and materials basis (T&M) pursuant to a separate Statement of Work for such services: • On-site technical support (OTS); Enhanced Service and Enhancements • Performing preventive maintenance for the Maintained Products; • Integration services, custom modifications, installation of Software Updates. Software Upgrades, or Software Patches; • Support for custom software features or third party' software not licensed to Customer by ALU; • Support for products used in a lab environment or for testing or development purposes except, with ALU’s prior consent, coverage may be extended to use of the Maintained Products in Customer's lab provided the lab use is incidental io Customer’s production use of another licensed copy in Customer's own communications network. Any coverage in such cases is at Standard Support level without regard to the Support Level applicable to Customer’s other Maintained Products. Respond-only objective will apply; • Making corrections to user-defined reports; • Assistance requested or service required resulting from: - Use of the Maintained Products in a manner not in accordance with its specifications, operating instructions, or license-to-use, or failure to continually provide a suitable operational v.010506 Confidential environment for the Maintained Product and any computing hardware on which a Maintained Product operates; - Changes in die designated processor; hardware configuration, the Maintained Products, or the software environment in which the Maintained Products operate; - Accident; disaster, which shall include, but not be limited to, fire, flood, earthquake, water, wind or lightning: transportation; neglect; or misuse; - Modifications, maintenance, or repair performed by other than ALU designated personnel; - Database problems not the direct result of a defect in the Maintained Products. - Products or systems oilier than the Maintained Products, including, but not limited to, products or systems that interface with the Maintained Products. 7. OTHER CUSTOMER RESPONSIBILITIES Customer is responsible for the following: • Providing a site ID or contract number, submitter name and location, callback telephone number and/or email address, system name and location, processor location, type and serial number, an alternate contact, diagnostic material if requested. • Providing a list of up to 15 designated and appropriately skilled individuals of Customer (for each Maintained Product) to submit telephone and website ARs. Only these designated individuals are authorized to submit ARs and ALU will be luider no obligation to respond to any unauthorized submittals. « Providing remote access to the Maintained Products (including remote electronic access to the computer system housing any Maintained Products) to enable ALU to perform remote technical support. • Ensuring that authorized staff for operation and maintenance are available during the entire support period to provide ALU with hi formation (e.g., model, serial number, current failure symptoms, etc.) upon request so that ALU can provide Customer with proper support. • Maintaining a procedure external to the software programs for reconstruction of lost or altered files, data, and/or programs. ALU will not be responsible for the loss of any data nor for die cost of reconstructing data stored on disk files, tapes, memories, etc. lost during die performance of RTS-A service or on account of the functioning of any of the Maintained Products. • Providing ALU a listing of output and all such other data, which ALU reasonably requests in order to reproduce (he conditions under which the problem occurred. If ALU is unable to verify an problem with an unmodified version of the Maintained Product, ALU shall have no further obligation to perform RTS-A for that reported problem • Maintaining the Maintained Products and system in which they are used: - Install all Software Patches within a reasonable time, not to exceed 30 days from delivery. - Follow all ALU’s and relevant third-party software manufacturer’s applicable installation, operation, administration, and maintenance instructions. - Maintain the Maintained Products to a current supported software release. Except in the case of service commencing upon installation by ALU of products purchased directly from ALU, ALU may, at its option, inspect products prior to the service commencement to confirm that such products are in satisfactory operating condition for RTS-A eligibility. The cost of such inspection, or of any service required for eligibility, will be charged to Customer at ALU’s then- current rates. a. PRICING/PRICING METHODOLOGY The Pricing for RTS-A is set forth in the SOA. The following additional pricing terms apply: (a) If Customer purchases additional products of the types listed on die SOA or additional license capacity on any Maintained Products during the Initial Term or any Renewal Tenn, Customer will pay maintenance fees at an amount equal to (on a per year basis) to 15% of the NET PRICE PAID (Standard Support Level) and if ordered, 17% (Standard Global Support Level) or 20% (Premium Support Level) and 22% (Premium Global Support Level) of the then current list price for all products listed on the SOA, pro  rated based on die number of months remaining in the applicable calendar year, (b) The annual RTS-A pricing may be increased provided ALU notifies Customer in writing no later Um 90 days prior to the end of die then-current calendar year of the Initial Tenn or Renewal Term, as applicable. Such increases shall not exceed 5% per year, (c) Out of Hours (OOH) services are those services that are requested by Standard Support Level Customers to be performed after Standard Support Hours (8:00 AM to 5:00 PM customer local time). Pricing for OOH service ARs is $500/hour with a two-hour minimum per AR issue. data.text: MaiE&ard Powered by ll/l/CO Direct AMENDMENT 2 TO CRITICAL COMMUNICATIONS RECOVERY AGREEMENT # PD-05-849-000-i This Amendment 2 effective January 1, 2020 (the "Amendment 2”) is made to the Print-to-Mail Continuity & Recovery Agreement effective January 1, 2016 (the "Agreement") by and between Instant Web LLC, d/b/a Mail-Gard (“Mail-Gard”), and Fidelity Information Services, LLC (“Customer”). WHEREAS, Customer and Mail-Gard desire to amend the Agreement upon the terms and conditions set forth herein; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the agreements and obligations set forth herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby mutually acknowledged, and with intent to be legally bound hereby, the parties hereto agree as follows: A. The Enterprise Recovery Solution - Scope of Services Requested, page 18, shall be deleted in its entirety and restated as follows: “Enterprise Recovery Solution - Scope of Services Requested FIS maintains 3 facilities in St. Petersburg, FL, San Antonio, TX and Boston, MA - volume may come from any of these locations, but is limited to the fractional specifications below. Communications: Mail-Gard will receive print image data from FIS through VPN using Blue Crest Enterprise Manager, peer-to-peer, or via IBM Enterprise Extender from FIS Data Center. Formatted print files will be in multiple formats including AFP, PDF, PCL, and Postscript. Print: 1. Approximately one million (1,000,000) simplex/duplex, MICR/non-MICR, monochrome images per day, printing on 18" x 11" or 17” x 11’ 2-up continuous forms or 8.5” x 11” cut sheet paper. Mail: 2. Approximately two hundred thousand (200,000) packages per day. Printed output to accumulate (average 1-3 pages per package), utilizing 2D & OMR barcode, and insert into #10 or 6 x 9 envelope. 98% of the mailings use permit indicia though a small volume will be metered. 99% of the documents will mail 1st class presort. INTERNAL SLA Averages o Same Day =15% • 1 Day = 25% • 2 Day = 20% o 3 Day = 40% Reported Annual Volumes by FIS Site are detailed below Note: Annual volumes are listed for reference only; fractional covered volumes are detailed above. 2016 Print Impressions Location Statement Impressions Check Stock Impressions Total Impressions St. Petersburg, FL 708,309,568 27,549,559 735,859,127 San Antonio, TX 396,278,679 30,588,265 426,866,944 Boston, MA 630,812,503 10,558,173 641,370,676 Total 1,735,400,750 68,695,997 1,804,096,747 2016 Mail Processed Location Statement Mail Processed Check Mail Processed Total Mail Processed St. Petersburg, FL 159,579,689 18,400,604 177,980,293 San Antonio, TX 114,646,419 20,050,598 134,697,017 Boston, MA 156,591,169 3,314,201 159,905,370 Total 430,817,277 41,765,403 472,582,680" B. Mail-Gard’s Monthly Subscription Fee, Guaranteed Access, page 20, shall be deleted in its entirety and restated as follows: “Mail-Gaid’s Monthly Subscription Fee: $7,750.00 per month" C. The Print and Mail Testing Services, page 20, shall be deleted in its entirety and restated as follows: “Services Description Per UOM Price Warehouse Fee Storage Fee for long-term storage (materials shipped for testing or declaration are not charged for storage) Per pallet, per month $46.50 Proof of Concept Test Up to 6 files Up to 2,000 envelopes Per exercise $2,000.00 Scheduled Exercises    Option 1: 4 Hour Test, Up to 6 files; Up to 2,000 pkgs Per exercise $2,500.00 Option 2: 6 Hour Test, 7-12 files; Up to 6,000 pkgs Per exercise $3,650.00 Option 3: 8 Hour Test, 13-20 files; Up to 10,000 pkgs Per exercise $4,800.00 Additional Files Optional Per file $250.00 INTERNAL 2 Additional Envelopes Optional Per 1,000 envelopes $144.00” D. The Disaster Recovery Usage Rates and Charges, page 20, shall be deleted in its entirety and restated as follows: “Supplemental Pricing - Disaster Recovery Usage Services To be charged only in the event of a disaster declaration  Production Services Description PerUOM Price Declaration Fee Due at time of declaration Per occurrence $10,000.00     Print Services    Monochrome Continuous form, simplex Per image $0.0066*  Continuous form, duplex Per image $0.0056*  Cut sheet, simplex Per image $0.0219*  Cut sheet, duplex Per image $0.0139*     Machine Insert Services Includes accumulate, fold, select inserting, sort/tray/mail & metering, if required   #10 Envelope Size 1-2 sheets (avg. set size per file) Per envelope $0.0197*  3-4 sheets (avg. set size per file) Per envelope $0.0338*  5+ sheets (avg. set size per file) Per envelope $0.0489*     6”x9” Envelope Size 1-4 sheets (avg. set size per file) Per envelope $0.0259*  5-8 sheets (avg. set size per file) Per envelope $0.0546*  9+ sheets (avg. set size per file) Per envelope $0.0641*     9” x 12” Envelope Size 1-15 sheets (avg. set size per file) Per envelope $0.1224*     Small File Handling Fee Applies to jobs where majority (>50°/o) of files are less than 2,500 pieces) Per file $20.00 Handworkers For Manual Services Per hour, per person $52.50 Presort Best available rate at time of need Per package TBD Postage - Additional Must receive prior to date of mailing Per package TBD *Note: If recovery assistance is requested for volumes/applications not covered in the fractional recovery requirements detailed in section A, a 30% surcharge will be applied to any print and mail usage rates for the uncontracted volumes/applications. E. The term of the Amendment 2 shall run coterminus to the Agreement term, extended through a previous Amendment, which will end on May 31, 2022. F. Except to the extent expressly amended hereby, no provisions of this Amendment 2 shall be deemed to alter or modify any term or provision of the Agreement or previous Amendments, which Agreement as expressly amended hereby is confirmed as in full force and effect. Ltd, a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, having its registered office at S-405(LGF), Greater Kailash Part II, New Delhi-1 1 0048, hereinafter referred to as "FIS" which expression shall include its successors and permitted assigns; And lluminar Engineering Services Pvt Ltd, a Company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956, having its registered place of business located at H-16/6, Office # 5, DLF Phase 1, Gurgaon - 122002, Haryana hereinafter referred to as “Contractor", which expression shall include its successors and permitted assigns. Contractor and FIS are individually referred as Party and collectively as Parties WHEREAS, FIS desires to avail the comprehensive annual maintenance services of Fire Alarm Control * - Panel (FAS) System and its related supporting equipment's, fiom Contractor; and AND WHEREAS, Contractor is willing to provide such services pursuant to the terms and conditions contained herein. , Fori 4 1 - •',L Ltd  initials \\ \\ initials Arborised Signatory NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained herein, the Parties agree as follows: 1. Scope of Services: a) Contractor undertakes the comprehensive maintenance and services of the Fire Alarm Control Panel (F AS) System services and its related supporting equipment’s installed (As per Anncxurc-A) at: Noida: 5C, Sector-126, Noida, G.B. Nagar, UP - 20130 1 (i) AMC services shall include all kinds of corrective and preventive maintenance. (ii) Check the power supply positions in control panel. (iii) Check the LED of panel through lamp test switch (iv) Check any fault if indicated on any of the panels and rectify the same immediately. (v) Check of bell and siren for its proper working. (vi) Check connectivity and communication at all tenninations, replace all faulty detectors, devices, control cards of main panels, repeater panels etc. installed for fire detection system by the Contracting Agency. (vii) Operational readiness of the entire system during mains failure (viii) Performance of the hooters (ix) Performance and manual cleaning of manual call points, panels, hooters hydrant box, smoke detectors etc. (x) Check Fault circuit of each zone by actually disconnecting the wire by removing a detector (xi) Checking/servicing of valve, panels etc (xii) Greasing of valves, checking of couplings (xiii) Resolve any issues regarding the system and take corrective actions for the fault existing (xiv) Inventory recording to help identify components for replacements or software for the latest versions/ upgrade patches. (xv) Install and re-commission defective detectors, devices and cards upon replacement/ repair (xvi) Maintain loop in and out connections, all call points, Rises, terminals, junction boxes used in the system. (xvii) All Electricians, Supervisors and labour will be arranged by Contracting Agency as required to maintain the contracted system unless explicitly stated in the contract (xviii) All spare parts, tools and tackles. laptop/ computer required to maintain the system shall be arranged by the Contracting Agency unless explicitly stated in the contract. (xix) The Contracting Agency shall be responsible for removal and replacement of all ceiling tiles affected by the work. Contractor shall dispose of any excess materials or other construction debris. (xx) FIS to liaise with other agencies if interfacing with non-Contracting Agency systems/ equipment is to be done. b) Service level agreements are more particularly described in Annexurc B. For L uminar s Pvt. Ltd. 2 Ised Signatory initials 2. FIS Responsibilities: FIS will provide all reasonable assistance to Contractor’s personnel for providing services as per the Agreement. 3. Term and Termination of Services: 3.1 The Services will commence with retrospective effect on July 9, 2020 and shall continue to be provided through July 8, 2023, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Agreement. After the expiry of initial period of three year, the Agreement shall automatically extend for another period of one year i.e. through April 30, 2024 on written notice. The term of this Agreement may be extended by mutual written agreement of the parties hereto. 3.2 Both Parties agree that FIS shall have the right to terminate this Agreement by giving a 30-day prior written notice to the other Party, without assigning any reason thereof. Contractor will also have a right to teminate the Agreement by giving a 30-day prior written notice to FIS on account of non-payment of correct invoice amount by FIS or on account of breach of any applicable law as recipient of services by FIS. 3.3 This Agreement may be immediately terminated by either Party in the event that the other Party (i) makes an assignment for the benefit of its creditors, (ii) goes into liquidation, (iii) has a receiver or trustee appointed for its property, (iv) has proceedings for voluntary bankruptcy instituted on its behalf (v) has proceedings for involuntary bankruptcy instituted against it that are not dismissed within 30 days or (vi) is declared bankrupt or insolvent by a court of competent jurisdiction. 3.4 Notwithstanding any of the terms of Agreement, FIS shall be entitled to terminate the said Agreement with immediate effect in the event of Contractor being implicated in a fraud, theft, default or any other malafide act. 3.5 In case of termination of Agreement as above, FIS shall be entitled to claim the refund of the proportionate services fees paid in advance to the contractor , for the unexpired services period, within 30 days from the date of termination of the Agreement failing which FIS shall be entitled to claim the unexpired contract amount along with interest @ 1.5% per delayed month or part thereof 4. Location of Services: The services will be performed at the locations mentioned in section 1 above. 5. Fees: 5.1 In consideration for the performance of Services hereunder, Contractor shall invoice FIS on a fixed fee basis in accordance with the following schedule: CAMC for Fire Panel @ Noida Office Year-1 Year -2 Year-3 S.N Location Description Model No AMC Value (INR) AMC Value (INR) AMC Value (INR) 1 Noida FAS System MS-9600LS Addressable 09 July 2020 to 08 July 2021 09 July 2021 to 08 July 2022 09 July 2022 to 08 July 2023 148000 156880 166293    3 Fo ■- ■ ".;.„ AutSfcgJsignatory 5.2 Services Fee/Price/Charges/Consideration payable to Contractor under this Agreement will be exclusive of Goods and Service Tax (OST) as may be applicable at the time of issuance of Invoice and the same will be billed separately. For the purposes of this Agreement, the term GST shall include the Central Goods and Service Tax (CGST), the State Goods and Service Tax (SGST), Union Territory Goods and Service Tax (UTGST), Integrated Goods and Service Tax (IGST) and any other taxes levied under the GST or other indirect tax related legislation in India as may be applicable. The term GST legislation/s should be accordingly interpreted. 5.3 Contractor undertake to do necessary compliance including timely issuance of Invoice or any other document, uploading the relevant entries on the GSTN and making payments of GST, cesses, interest, penalties or any other tax/duty/amount/charge or other statutory liabilities arising either out of applicable laws/regulations or because of a demand/recovery initialed by any Revenue or other Statutory Authorities under applicable laws/regulations. 5.4 Contractor shall inform on a timely basis the compliance rating that is being assigned to it. The manner and periodicity for communicating such ratings can be mutually agreed with the Contractor, however the same shall not be less than once in a year. 5.5 Contractor agrees that it will be solely responsible for performing all compliance including correct classification and making payments of GST, cesses, interest, penalties or any other tax/duty/amount/charges or other statutory liabilities arising either out of applicable laws/regulations. 5.6 In case any GST and /or cess liability, interest, penalties or other tax/duty/amount/charge/other statutory liabilities/professional costs becomes payable by FIS or input credit is denied to FIS due to failure of the Contractor to comply with the applicable laws/regulations, the Contractor undertakes to indemnify FIS for an amount equal to amount payable/foregone by FIS. 5.7 FIS reserves the right to adjust any recovery to be made by it for losses suffered due to failure on part of the Contractor by adjusting it or withholding it from any amount deposited with FIS any other amount payable by FIS to Contractor (present or future). 5.8 In case the Contractor get blacklisted, FIS shall be entitled to recover amounts equivalent to the input tax credit denied (including applicable interest and penalty) and tax (if any) on such recoveries. 6. Expenses: FIS will not reimburse Contractor for expenses incurred. 7. The Data Sheet identifies the Volume Software, services, pricing and additional items offered to End User for purchase directly from EMC. This TLA does not amend the Governing Agreement for any other transactions. For the avoidance of doubt, the parties acknowledge and agree that this TLA docs not modify or otherwise affect the July 9, 2013 Quote 1005244901 (the “Quote”) and September 29, 2015, Enterprise License Agreement, and subsequent amendments thereto, between EMC and End User’s wholly owned subsidiary Vantiv, LLC (the “2015 ELA”), and that the Quote and the 2015 ELA remains in full force and effect. The foregoing agreements remain in full force and effect with respect to their respective subject matters. For further clarity, the parlies acknowledge and agree that End User is not licensed to deploy or use any of the ELA Software titles set forth in the 2015 ELA (or any amendment or addendum thereto) and/or any of the Licensed Software titles set forth in the 2016 Worldpay UK VSQ (any amendment or addendum thereto) under the terms and conditions of this TLA. 2. DEFINITIONS. 2.1 Incorporated Definitions. Unless specifically provided otherwise in this TLA, all terms defined in the Governing Agreement shall have the same meaning when used herein. Additional defined terms shall have the meaning set forth in this TLA. 3. TERM AND TERMINATION OF TLA. Unless sooner terminated pursuant to a provision of this TLA or for cause pursuant to Section 16(1) the Governing Agreement and/or Section 3.4 of Exhibit A attached hereto, the term of this TLA expires at the last day of the Deployment Period, whichever occurs later. Additionally, pursuant to Section 4(G) of the Governing Agreement, any of the licenses granted hereunder are subject to termination by EMC in the event of End User's materia! breach of the terms governing use of the Volume Software. and (ii) does not require a software license key, that EMC has provided and End User has installed the unit of Volume Software in a production environment (and not in a lest environment). • “Entitled Affiliatcfs)” means an Affiliate(s) of End User located in the United Stales and the United Kingdom, and unless specifically excluded, included within the definition of End User. • “Growth Licenses" means the quantity of Licensing Units of the applicable Volume Software that (i) if identified in Table 1.2 below for use with a System, arc obtained hereunder for use only on Systems obtained after the Effective Date and which are not Refresh Systems; REGISTERED CAPACITY MODEL Model Description Licensing and pricing is based upon the Registered Capacity of one or more storage array, server, or other device (s) on which the Software is licensed for use. The Registered Capacity describes the maximum quantity of data for which the functionality of the Software is authorized for use. The total capacity of the device may exceed the Registered Capacity that the Software is licensed to operate on. Software that is licensed on the basis of Registered Capacity is typically licensed for use only on a specifically identified storage array or other hardware device. Each storage array or other hardware device requires the purchase of (i) an Initial base product (independent of Registered Capacity) and (ii) an additional quantity of add-on products that reflect the amount of Registered Capacity on which the applicable Software is authorized for use. Customers may subsequently determine they need to use the Software in connection with an amount of data that exceeds the current Registered Capacity. In such cases, customers must either purchase on appropriate number of additional licenses to cover the increase in the Registered Capacity. or purchase a new base product plus Software in Instances where a capacity limitation has been reached. Model Specific Terms and Conditions • The purchase of a base product license plus add-on product licenses (which are measured by Registered Capacity) are both needed to use the Software product(s). RAW CAPACITY MODEL MEASURED IN TERABYTES OR GIGABYTES (AS SPECIFIED ON THE QUOTE) Model Description Licensing and pricing is based upon the total capacity of the storage array or other devices on which the Software is licensed for use. Software licensed on the basis of Raw Capacity is typically licensed for use only on a specifically identified storage array. This model uses a "base plus capacity" approach as described in the Registered Capacity model above, where the customer purchases one base product license and then purchases incremental capacity add-on product licenses to equal the raw capacity of the system on which the Software will operate. Model Specific Terms and Conditions • A base product license plus add-on product licenses (which are measured by Raw Capacity) are both needed to use the Software product(s). USABLE CAPACITY MODEL MEASURED IN TERABYTES OR GIGABYTES (AS SPECIFIED ON THE QUOTE) Model Description Licensing and pricing are based upon the Usable Capacity of one or more storage arrays, servers, or other devices on which the Software is licensed for use. The Usable Capacity describes the maximum quantity of data for which the functionality of the Software is authorized for use. The Usable Capacity of a licensed device is calculated by MC on the basis of the Raw Capacity minus Overhead. Raw DocuSign Envelope ID: 0BB91088-D5C0-4522-BF19-B19C7126FD24 Capacity is the total data storage capacity of a licensed device. Overhead is that portion of Raw Capacity which EMC determines is reserved for or allocated to spares, RAID types and applications running on a licensed device and on which the software functionality is not to be used. Software that is licensed on the basis of Usable Capacity is typically licensed for use only on a specifically identified storage array or other hardware device. The Customer or Dell EMC may subsequently make a change to the Raw Capacity, configuration. RAID level or overall environment of a licensed device that increases the Usable Capacity to an amount in excess of the quantity for which the Software has been licensed. In these cases. Customer must purchase an appropriate additional license to cover the increase in the Usable Capacity. Model Specific Term and Conditions • The purchase of a base product license plus add-on product licenses [which are measured by Usable Capacity) are needed to use the Software product(s). INSTANCE MODEL Model Description Ucensing and pricing is based upon the nature of the hardware platform on which the Software operates. It includes servers that run a single instance, partition, or virtual machine as well as servers that run multiple instances, partitions, or virtual machines [both physical and virtual machines). Each partition running the application constitutes an instance. This model is also used with server-based Software and Software that is licensed to a specific storage array or to an engine within a storage array. An engine consists of a CPU, cache and data storage (regardless of the speed, performance or capacity of the engine components), as designated by Dell EMC. Adding an engine to an existing storage array enclosure is designated as an upgrade to the existing storage array. This model is also used with clusters. A cluster is a collection of more than one node. Model Specific Terms and Conditions • Server-based Software licensed in accordance with the Instance model is generally priced for a particular OS type, such as Windows. Solaris, etc. • An Instance license may provide support for only a single application type, such as Exchange or Oracle. • Isilon clusters have a minimum of three (3) nodes. MANAGED ENTITY UCENSING MODEL Model Description Licensing and pricing Is based upon the total number of entities being managed or inspected by the Software. An entity is defined as any singular item being managed or monitored by the Dell EMC Software and can include third-party hardware, a running instance of a software program, an abstract resource (such as an email inbox), or a user. The Software licensed under this model may be used on or with a specific entity or quantity of entities of a specified type. Examples of physical devices include, but ore not limited to: routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, storage arrays, NAS data movers. NAS systems, blades, and IP phones. Examples of instances of a software program include, but are not limited to: databases, volume managers, file systems, operating systems, hypervisors, backup software systems, and CMDB systems, An example of an abstract resource is an email inbox being inspected or managed by the Software product. An example of a user as a managed entity is a user that authenticates to a VPN or some other system using the Software product. A managed entity based on a consistency group consists of a named set of identified storage devices, located at the same physical site, that are treated as a single unit to enable the devices to act in unison to maintain the integrity of data that is distributed across those same devices. For example, devices using the Symmetrix® Remote Data Facility that are identified as belonging to the some consistency group act in unison to preserve the dependent write consistency of a database distributed among the devices in the consistency group. DocuSign Envelope ID: 0BB91088-D5C0-4522-BF19-B19C7126FD24 Model Specific Terms and Conditions • Managed Entity Metric Considerations: Under this licensing model, some Software will be licensed by the total number of entities the Software is interacting with while other Software will be licensed for specifically identified entities. PROCESS RATE LICENSING MODEL Model Description licensing and pricing is based upon the cumulative amount of work done by the Software over a specified time period. Model Specific Terms and Conditions • Tiered pricing (price per mailbox decreases as the number of email mailboxes purchased increases). • Licensing for EMC EmalIXtender is limited to the sole and exclusive benefit and use of the user. License rights may not be further assigned or sublicensed to any other party for any other purpose. NAMED USER LICENSING MODEL Model Description Licensing and pricing is based upon the total number of unique named users or seats accessing the Software, whether such users are actively using the Software, or accessing the Software at any given time. If a named user of the Software leaves the employ of the customer, or moves into a role that doesn't require access to the Software, the seat does not have to be relinquished by the customer, but can be reassigned to a different named user. UNIQUE USER VIDEO INSTRUCTOR-LED TRAINING STREAMING LICENSING ("VILTS") MODEL Model Description Licensing and pricing is based upon the number of Customer's individual, unique-named employees or agents authorized to view a VILTS course (“Authorized Users"] and each instance of an Authorized User clicking on or launching a unique VILTS title is deemed a single use of a VILTS license. CONCURRENT USER LICENSING MODEL Model Description This model specifies the maximum number of concurrent users who are accessing the Software at any instance in time. CENTRAL PROCESSING UNIT (“CPU") MODEL Model Description Licensing and pricing is based upon the total number of CPUs present in the computer upon which the Software will operate. A two-tier system is used based on the number of cores present. These two tiers can be combined as needed on CPUs with greater than 12 cores. Neither tier can be split across more than one CPU. INDIVIDUAL CENTRAL PROCESSING UNIT (“CPU") CORE MODEL Model Description Licensing and pricing is based upon the number of "Cores" on which the Software will operate. A "Core" is defined on the basis of the environment in which the Software operates. DocuSign Envelope ID: 0BB91088-D5C0-4522-BF19-B19C7126FD24 When operating the Software in a "bare metal" environment, which means a physical machine without a hypervisor product capable of creating Virtual Machines, and excludes operation within a cloud service environment, a "Core" equals a single, computational unit of the processor. When operating the Software in a hypervisor (Virtual Machine) environment, a "Core" equals a single unit of virtual processing power (commonly referred to as a "vCPU'j configured to each Virtual Machine. A Virtual Machine is a software container able to run its own operating system and execute applications, just as a physical computer does. When operating the Software in a public cloud services env'ronment, a "Core" equals a single, basic, most granular unit of computational power as defined by the cloud service provider. This may include, but is not limited to such units expressed as the number of “vCPUs." "virtual CPUs," "virtual cores," and "dynos." When used with respect to Pivotal software titles, please reference the Pivotal Product Guide posted at www.oivotol.io/product-quide for a complete description of this licensing model (including the meaning of defined terms) in lieu of the above. CENTRAL PROCESSING UNIT (“CPU') MEASURED BY MSU MODEL Model Description Licensing and pricing is based upon the maximum combined capacity of the CPUs contained within a mainframe device, os determined by the industry standard measurement of Millions of Service Units (MSU) to reflect the processing power of the mainframe device, irrespective of the type of processor or the workload. FOUNDATION AND FOUNDATION RELATED LICENSING MODELS (FA, FB, FC, FD, AND FE) Model Descriptions A complete description of these licensing models (including the meaning of defined terms) for Pivotal software titles is contained in the Pivotal Product Guide posted at www.pivotal.io/product-quide. POD LICENSING MODEL (PD) Model Description A complete description of this licensing model (including the meaning of defined terms) for Pivotal software titles is contained in the Pivotal Product Guide posted at www pivotaLio/oroduct-auide. Software Access and Use Requirements Except as otherwise agreed in writing, licenses are required for each device/user accessing or using the Software, notwithstanding any non-DellEMC technology used to: (I) reduce the number of devices or users the Software directly manages: (ii) pool connections; or (iii) reduce the number of devices/users accessing or using the Software. Pure Custom Client Per-Seat licenses of Pure Custom Client are required for each user of each software application accessing a Content Server repository and deploying ful read/write access to the Content Server, including applications providing end-user access via application servers, commerce servers, Web servers, or personalization servers DocuSign Envelope ID: 0BB91088-D5C0-4522-BF19-B19C7126FD24 Read-Only Access Per-Seat licenses of Read-Only Client, or Documentum Platform Bundle, which includes Read-Only entitlement, are required for each user of each software application accessing a Content Server repository and deploying read-only access to the Content Server, including applications providing access via application servers, commerce servers, Web servers or personalization servers on your behalf. Read-Only Access is limited to the following Content Server functionality only: individual login, individualized security, query/search capability, viewing of content and properties, and personalized delivery of content based on user or information and/or security. Access to the following functionality is excluded from Read-Only Access: import or creation of new content, editing of existing content or properties (check in/checkout), creation of and participation in workflows, promotion or demotion of content in a lifecycle, creation of lifecycles, or any other operation that changes the content of a Content Server repository. The customer is responsible tor proper configuration of the system to ensure that Read-Only users are limited to read-only functionality via access control settings. The Documentum Platform Bundle license provides entitlement for Read-Only access using Webtop or third-party custom clients. No other Documentum clients may be used for Read-Only access. AppSync ICDM Starter Bundle The AppSync ICDM Starter Bundle license has three restrictions: Up to 20 simultaneous mounted copies: The App Sync iCDM Started Bundle license allows the creation of an unlimited number of Application Copies via AppSync software, but no more than twenty (20) Application Copies at any point of time. This limit only applies to the Application Copies that are created with AppSync software. An Application Copy Is defined as the set of storage volumes on a single XtremIO array that are presented to an application. For example if the user copies and mounts an application data set that consists of three volumes, those comprise one mounted application copy since aH three volumes are used together for the application. A single XtremIO array per AppSync server: With this license a dedicated AppSync Server is required per licensed XtremIO array. Specifically, this license to use the AppSync iCDM Starter Bundles cannot be Installed or used on an AppSync Server that already manages another array. Customers wishing to add multiple XtremIO arrays to the same AppSync Server are required to purchase the unlimited AppSync license. Manage only local copies (Bronze service plan for resiliency): With this license AppSync Is limited to local replication plans. That includes XtremIO Virtual Copies as well as RecoverPoint Local Replication when the same XtremIO array serves os both source and target. Captiva lnpuL4cre/(IA) and Documentum Reporting Services (DRS) Each licensed installation of IA and DRS includes a single copy of SAP's Business Objects Crystal Reports Designer, which you may use solely in connection with your licensed use of IA or DRS, and only with data created or used by IA or DRS. You may not Install more than one copy of Crystal Reports Designer per licensed Installation of IA or DRS. PowerPath In the VMAX AFA 450/850 FX package PowerPath and PowerPath/VE is included as part of the VMAX AFA 450/850 FX software package for use only with the hosts physically connected to the storage array for which the VMAX AFA 450/850 FX software package is licensed. PowerPath licenses for FX are not transferable and can only be used on the hardware for which they were originally licensed. xPlore Software Use of EMC's ApplicationXtender xPlore software product is only permitted with content residing in EMC's ApplicationXtender software product. No standalone use of xPlore is permitted except with the written consent of Dell EMC. DocuSign Envelope ID: 0BB91088-D5C0-4522-BF19-B19C7126FD24 xCP User Single App is licensed for o Named User to access a single xCP-based application. If a user needs access to more than one xCP-based application, an additional xCP Single App license is required or the user should be licensed for the xCP User Unlimited license. Application Specific Licensing (ASL) Any software product Dell EMC designates as Application Specific License products, including the underlying components of any software bundle, may only be used for the specific solution/application for which it is licensed. Use of the software or any individual components for any other purpose. Including general content management functionality, is prohibited. The following is a partial fist of software products designated as ASL products: EMC Clinical Archiving EMC Documentum for Life Sciences - Quality and Manufacturing EMC Documentum for Life Sciences - Electronic Trial Master File EMC Documentum for Life Sciences - Research and Development EMC Documentum for Life Sciences - Submissions Store and View EMC Engineering, Plant and Facilities Management - Asset Operations EMC Engineering, Plant and Facilities Management-Capital Projects EMC InfoArchive EMC Medical Image Manager EMC Medical Records Manager TEMPORARY TERM EXPIRING LICENSES Evaluation and Other Non-productlon Use Licenses in certain instances and at Dell EMC's discretion. Dell EMC may grant a short-term license for the purpose of demonstration, evaluation, or some other non-production internal use. Such license may be issued as a 30-day license for standalone Software or a 90-day license for array-based systems Software. At the end of the temporary term, the license to use the Software expires and the Software may cease to operate. The temporary term begins once the licenses are made available (e.g„ either by making the Software available for download or by delivering the CD to the customer). Failover Expiring Licenses Each license entitlement includes the right to run the Software on a separate computer in a failover environment for up to 30 separate days In any given calendar year for purposes of emergency management. Any use beyond the right granted in the previous sentence must be licensed separately and the same license metric must be used when licensing the Software. License keys for such licenses must be obtained from DELL EMC by making a request through the applicable Dell EMC Online Support website at https://support.ernc.com/. Backup Testing Expiring License For the purpose of testing physical copies of backups, license rights include the capability to run the Software on an unlicensed computer for up to 30 days in any given calendar year. License keys for such licenses must be obtained from Dell EMC by making a request through the applicable Dell EMC Online Support website at https://suppprt.emc.com/. Any use beyond the right granted in the previous sentence must be licensed separately and the same license metric must be used when licensing the Software. Emergency Expiring License Dell EMC will allow and support the use of emergency licenses for customer critical situations, such as getting bock into production in a disaster recovery situation or resolving a situation with an incorrect License Key being delivered. Each license entitlement includes the right to run the Software on an unlicensed separate computer for up to 30 separate days in any given calendar year. License keys for such licenses must be obtained from Dell EMC by making a request through the applicable Dell EMC DocuSign Envelope ID: 0BB91088-D5C0-4522-BF19-B19C7126FD24 Online Support website at https://supDort.emc.com/. Any use beyond the right granted in the previous sentence must be licensed separately and the same license metric must be used when licensing the software. Service License Dell EMC will allow the use of service-refated licenses for customer situations in conjunction with Dell EMC's support organization when initiated and used by Dell EMC support personnel. The license includes the right to run the Software on an unlicensed separate computer for up to 30 separate days in any given calendar year. MOVE POLICY A "move" of a Software license is defined as when the original licensee stops using a Software product on one system or device and begins using it on another of the licensee’s own systems or devices. Software Typo Moveable? Comments
Operating Environment (OE) No Operating system-type software installed on Dell EMC storage device or other hardware. Enables basic system functionality. This Software is licensed solely for use on the hardware device on which it is shipped; therefore, the license is not eligible to be moved to another device.
OE Application Yes Software applications that can only run on Dell EMC OE Software. Move permitted, provided: Software is under maintenance; customer agrees to discontinue use of the Software on the original host system; the features, functionality, and price of the Software are the same on the new and old host systems; the source host system is technologically compatible with the target host system; any applicable move fees are paid to Dell EMC.
Platform Yes Software applications that run on non- Dell EMC OE's but interacts with Dell EMC products. Move permitted, provided: Software is under maintenance; customer agrees to discontinue use of the Software on the original DELL EMC hardware system; the features, functionality, and price of the Software are the same on the new and old Deli EMC hardware systems; the source Dell EMC hardware system is technologically compatible with the target Dell EMC hardware system; the move is not prohibited by the product support agreement: any applicable move fees are paid to Dell EMC. Given the above constraints, the following additional rules apply: • Moves from multiple systems to one system (consolidation) are allowed. • Moves from one system to two or more systems are not allowed, os a software license is indivisible. • Moving a raw capacity license to a second system for use as a registered capacity license is not allowed and vice versa.
Host Application Yes Software which is not designed solely for installation and use on a Deli EMC storage device, but which runs on a standalone server, an appliance or some other hardware device. Move permitted, provided: Software is under maintenance; customer agrees to discontinue use of the Software on the original host system; the features, functionality, and price of the Software ore the same on the new and old host systems; the source host system is technologically compatible with the target host system; any applicable move fees are paid to Dell EMC.
DocuSign Envelope ID: 0BB91088-D5C0-4522-BF19-B19C7126FD24 TRANSFER POLICY "Transfer" of a Software license is defined as when the original licensee has stopped using a Software product and wants to seli or otherwise transfer the rights to use the Software to a secondary purchaser. Dell EMC does not allow transfers under any circumstances; in all cases, the secondary purchaser must purchase a new license to run the Software. Copyright © 2012-2017 Del! Inc. or its subsidiaries.
