data.text: DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 STATEMENT OF WORK No. 402 PBBA Migration Scrum team WorldPay Reference   BETWEEN WorldPay (UK) Limited, a company incorporated and registered in England and Wales, having the company number 07316500, whose registered office is Walbrook Building, 25 Walbrook, London, EC4N 8AF (“WorldPay” or the “Client”); And Endava (UK) Limited, a company incorporated and registered in England, having the company number 03919935, whose registered office is at 125 Old Broad Street, London EC2N 1AR (“Endava”). 1. INTERPRETATION 1. This Statement of Work is made on the terms of the Master Services Agreement for Services entered into between the Parties, dated 30th April 2014 as amended from time to time (the “Framework Agreement”). 2. Except as expressly stated otherwise in this Statement of Work: a. the terms and conditions set out in the Framework Agreement shall apply to this Statement of Work; and b. capitalised words and expressions in this Statement of Work shall have the meanings given to them in the Framework Agreement. The following capitalized words and expressions have the meanings specified below: a. “SoW” means this Statement of Work b. "WPG” - Worldpay Payment Gateway c. “PBB Application” - Pay by Bank application is a new, easy-to-use payment method from Mastercard®. It lets your customers pay online quickly and securely from their trusted mobile bank app, without having to enter payment details, create new accounts or logins, or remember any additional passwords. d. “End to end Testing” - is a methodology used in the software development lifecycle (SDLC) to test the functionality and performance of an application under product-like circumstances and data to replicate live settings. The goal is to simulate what a real user scenario looks like from start to finish. e. “OCP 4.0- an Operator-driven platform that delivers full-stack automation from top to bottom. It is a platform as a service cluster called RedHat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) which handles most of the operational aspects of the service. The platform itself handles all things related to availability, scalability, security and abstracts the interaction with the hardware resources. Services run within isolated components called Pods and this minimizes the risk of undesired cross services access. Current version is 4.0 1 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 f. "SonarQube" an open-source platform developed by SonarSource for continuous inspection of code quality to perform automatic reviews with static analysis of code to detect bugs, code smells, and security vulnerabilities on 20+ programming languages. g. "Checkmarx" CxSAST is a unique source code analysis solution that provides tools for identifying, tracking, and repairing technical and logical flaws in the source code, such as security vulnerabilities, compliance issues, and business logic problems h. "Live proving" provides 'true' end to end testing using live account information i. "Merchant Boarding” The process of signing-up and loading those merchants to a payment processor j. "Pilot” is small-scale testing in production to ensure that the service performs the intended functionality in production including complete roundtrip; the merchant confirms that new product is meeting their needs; integration with third parties is working fine; issues, if any, are identified at early stage and fixed; the Implementation Manager, Relationship Manager and Product Manager try out the on-boarding process for merchants; teams understand the production support processes, monitors, alerts and dashboards k. "BRO” Build - Reuse- Operate l. "Recurring payment’ a payment model where the customers authorize the merchant to pull funds from their accounts automatically at regular intervals for the goods and services provided to them on an ongoing basis m. "Merchant initiated transactions” (MIT) is an authorization that you initiate when a cardholder is not present. n. "GPPaaS” Global Payment Products as a Service o. "ABC workshop" Accelerated Business Case workshop designed to get make a SMART Decision in 1 day or less. p. "SDLC” Software Development Life Cycle is a process that produces software with the highest quality and lowest cost in the shortest time q. "Production Incident" means single technical failure experienced by Worldpay within the scope of the Application supported by the Services in a live environment. r. "Agile” means a development process that has the following main characteristics: activities are split in cycles known as sprints; requirements are written in the form of user stories along with associated acceptance criteria and are prioritized. s. "Codebase" the complete body of source code for a given software program or application. t. "Problem” means a single error or defect generating multiple incidents. u. "Problem Management” means the identification and resolution of the common root cause to multiple Incidents within the Application v. "Change Request” means a request to change any existing Services, or for Endava to provide new services. w. Customer” means the Worldpay customers using the applications in scope of Annex 1. x. "HPP Team” Hosted Payment Pages Team 2 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 2. DURATION OF SOW The services in this Statement of Work shall commence on 1 st of September 2021 (the "Service Start Date”) and shall expire (unless terminated earlier in accordance with the Framework Agreement) on 30th June 2023. For the purpose of providing a high-level overview the project is divided into 4 phases with estimated dates as follows: Phase 1: 01 st September 2021- 15 th November 2021 Phase 2: 16 th November 2021- 30th of June 2022 Phase 3: 1st of July 2022 - 31st of December 2022 Phase 4: 1st January 2023 - 30 th June 2023 The delivery dates and the actual cost of the project depend on the actual backlog, dependencies, team velocity other factors that cannot be foreseen now. Together with Worldpay, Endava will commonly agree “mitigation" actions which could mean increase team size, date changes or other actions as required by the circumstances. 3. DESCRIPTION OF THE SERVICES 3.1 3.1 Background, Objectives and Critical Success Criteria (to this SoW) Background This SOW is to engage Endava to provide Java application development and testing services that would migrate the current PayByBank Application code-base to OCP 4.0 without going through GPPaaS as well as to release the software into production environment and provide subsequent BRO support for an initial period of 3 months. Endava shall provide the Client with one near-shore team to provide development and testing services, in accordance with the direction and prioritisation provided by the Client. The technology solution is based upon JAVA, specifically designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible. Endava will follow an agile development process for this Statement of Work. Construction activities will take place in cycles known as sprints (“Sprint"). User requirements will be written in the form of user stories (“User Stories") along with associated acceptance criteria (“User Story Acceptance Criteria"). Endava will work with the Client to continuously provide effort estimates for and prioritise User Stories according to business value, effort estimates, critical path and dependencies. Each Sprint will end with a Sprint demo session to demonstrate to the Client the progress made during the current Sprint, followed by a retrospective session to support the continuous improvement of the adaptive development process, based on feedback from Endava teams and Client. 3 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 Objectives Code developed by the Endava team is in a state of completion to allow a first merchant to be boarded in the pilot phase by end of Q2/2022. The target date for the pilot phase and the actual cost of the project depends on the actual backlog, dependencies, team velocity other factors that cannot be foreseen now. Together with Worldpay, Endava will commonly agree "mitigation" actions which could mean increase team size, date changes or other actions as required by the circumstances. Critical Success Criteria The key success criteria for the team are: • The code quality will meet the quality-of-service standards used as common practice in the A2APM train • Live Proving is successful This assignment will be overseen by: Endava Delivery Manager: Vlad Salagean WorldPay Service Owner: Sarah Gerald 3.2 Services 3.2.1. In Scope The following Services will be provided under this Statement of Work: Development Services Phase 1: - Onboard a new team - Get the team access to the needed FIS systems & project documentation - Setting up of the development environment including Continuous Integration solution, GIT SCM - Allow team to familiarize with the project code & requirements & FIS environments & working practices - Have investigations on the current code - ABC workshop to provide an estimate and a plan The target date for phase 1 and the actual cost of the project depends on the actual backlog, dependencies, team velocity other factors that cannot be foreseen now. Together with 4 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 Worldpay, Endava will commonly agree "mitigation" actions which could mean increase team size, date changes or other actions as required by the circumstances. Phase 2: - Migrate the code base to OCP4. - Implement the requirements described in Table 1 - Perform end to end testing - Release the software into production under the required non-functional performance requirements - Provide support to business for first merchant onboarding Table 1 Phase 2 Requirements No Title Work Observations 1 Logging • Find solution for logging library  2 Merchant registration (success & failure) • Add key-value pair: correlationID, merchantCode, event, step and change logging level to INFO • Change the error log so the error to be more descriptive • Log request and response from service - 3rd party communication separately • Log sync response sent to WPG  3 Merchant registration (success & failure) • One line header and logging level to be changed to INFO, remove header  4 Merchant registration (success & failure) • Remove JWT • Obfuscate accountNumber, sortCode & address Might be important to be obfuscated 5 Payment (SEND FOR  AUTHORISATI ON, ERROR • Log received request on one line, on INFO level • Log request and response from service - 3rd party communication separately  5 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455   • Log sync response sent to WPG  6 Payment (SEND FOR  AUTHORISATI ON, ERROR • Obfuscate address, firstName, lastName and email to be obfuscated and maybe ip address in the request response Might be important to be obfuscated 7 Notifications (AUTHORISE D) WPG • Add key-value pair: aptrId, administationCode, orderCode and amount logging to be fixed, log in minor unit  8 Notifications (AUTHORISE D) • Log request received from 3rd party • Change logging level to INFO • Remove/one line the header • Add key value pairs for correlationId, aptrId, merchantCode, paymentId, orderCode, event, step • Update the error log to be more descriptive • Log response sent to WPG  9 Refund WPG • Add key-value pair for orderCode & AccountNumber & AccountSortCode • Obfuscate AccountNumber & AccountSortCode  10 Refund • Log Request received • Change logging levet to INFO • Remove/One line header • Remove JWT • Add key value pairs for correlationId, aptrId, merchantCode, paymentId, orderCode, event, step • Log request and response from 3rd party separately, obuscate acctNum & SortCode • Log response sent to WPG • Update error log to be more descriptive  6 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 11 Logging - security issue log • Remove Log line: 2021-01-05 09:55:48.038 WARN o.a.wss4j.common.crypto.Cryp toBase ~#~ service="PBBAService", No Subject DN Certificate Constraints were defined. This could be a security issue  12 Splunk Dashboard Service • Update and test existing panels 20 panels 13 Enhance Splunk Dashboard Service Add new panels for: • TPM Historic • Service Error rate % • Service Erros rate (Value) • Service Error rate - historic  14 Enhance Splunk Dashboard WPG Add new panels for: • WPG Error rate % • WPG Error rate (Value) • WPG Error rate (Historic) • WPG AVG Latency (Historic) - I think you may already have this though • Counter of number of retries  15 Enhance Splunk Dashboard Service Add new panels for: • Total AUTH requests • Total AUTHs To be similar with Klarna service Dashboard 16 Splunk Alerts • Review & update search queries & thresholds 4 alerts 17 New Splunk Alerts Additional alerts (with corresponding KB's): • WPG Error rate • Service Error rate • Refusal rate (if applicable?)  7 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455   • Retry increase • Drop in volume (requests) • Latency  18 Knowledge Base Article • Review articles • Update articles with investigation steps  19 New Knowledge Base Article • Create new KBs for new alerts  20 Liveness and readiness probes • Integrate new version of Spring boot • Modify OCP configurations  21 Automation • Include automation in the pipeline  22 Fix Checkmarx Issues • Log forging issue (LOW)  23 Fix Sonar Issues • Service: one bug, one security vulnerability, 5 security hot spots, 10 code smells • Notification Service: one security hot spot, 4 code smells  24 Increase code coverage • Notification Service: 86.5% Service: 92.5%  25 PIT mutation testing • Include it in the pipeline.  26 Update Certificate for external route   The target date for phase 2 and the actual cost of the project depends on the actual backlog, dependencies, team velocity other factors that cannot be foreseen now. Together with Worldpay, Endava will commonly agree "mitigation" actions which could mean increase team size, date changes or other actions as required by the circumstances. 8 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 Phase 3 Scope - Provide BRO support - Bugfixes - Work on "recurring payments” & “merchant-initiated transactions" functionalities - Release the new functionality into production in agreement with FIS process - Relevant Documentation The target date for phase 3 and the actual cost of the project depends on the actual backlog, dependencies, team velocity other factors that cannot be foreseen now. Together with Worldpay, Endava will commonly agree “mitigation” actions which could mean increase team size, date changes or other actions as required by the circumstances. Phase 4 Scope: - Ongoing support - Knowledge Transfer The target date for phase 4 and the actual cost of the project depends on the actual backlog, dependencies, team velocity other factors that cannot be foreseen now. Together with Worldpay, Endava will commonly agree “mitigation” actions which could mean increase team size, date changes or other actions as required by the circumstances. BRO Services. The following services will be provided under this Statement of Work (the “BRO Services”) by the Supplier Personnel allocated under BRO: - Bug fixing and maintenance during Sprints; - Production Incidents support accordance with Annex 1 and Annex 2; - BRO services, as set out in Schedule 2 (Definitions of Services and Acceptance) of the Framework Agreement, in collaboration with Worldpay to produce relevant artefacts allowing the PBB Application to transition into production. Artefacts include knowledge base documentation and workbooks to follow in order for Level 1 Support teams to deal with service Incidents. In the event of an Incident, Worldpay incident managers may require the relevant IT Supplier Personnel providing On-call Support to join a call with customers or 3rd-parties in order to provide relevant information such as technical detail or status updates. As part of Problem Management, Endava will work with Worldpay to establish the root cause of the Problem, as well as to plan and implement any remediation activities to reduce risk or impact of further Incidents and ensure knowledge articles are updated accordingly. 9 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 Change Requests will be raised by the Scrum Team with the support and knowledge of the Worldpay personnel as needed. The BRO Team will deal with any Change Request and Worldpay approval processes (e.g. Change Advisory Board) as required to allow production changes to be deployed. Endava shall follow the applicable process as defined by Worldpay for the relevant BRO Services. 3.2.2. Out of scope Any additional requirements not covered under chapter 3.2.1 In Scope. 4. KEY DELIVERABLES Under this Statement of Work, Endava will provide the Services described in section 3.2 above on a time and materials basis. The delivery of these Services will be managed by WorldPay and will result in the following types of deliverables (the "Deliverables"): - Source code & binary for the PBB Application - Documentation & release instructions for the work performed - Release plan - Biweekly status report - Monthly report of • actuals vs forecast for previous month b) updated forecast per quarter • the sum of actuals and forecast vs budgeted per quarter 4.1 Completion, Acceptance Tests and Acceptance Test Criteria Unless otherwise specified above, where the deliverable is a change to code, Completion, Acceptance Tests and Acceptance Criteria are those specified in Schedule 2 of the Framework Agreement. 10 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 5. Progress Monitoring and Reporting Endava will report progress against the Deliverables described in section 4 above based on existing staff availability. The report will provide status and updates on the schedule, resources, quality, risk and scope as outlined below: A) Summary of the current progress against the scope committed B )Milestone progress - A 'Red', 'Amber', 'Green' (RAG) status against each milestone where: Status Definition Red The milestone will not/has not been met Amber The milestone date is under threat, but realistic and achievable actions are in place to bring activities back on track Green The milestone has or will be achieved C) Status and updates on the schedule, resources, quality, risk and scope; D) Progress against base line plan; E) Summary of the current progress against the scope committed; F) Status of dependencies on other 3rd parties; G) Updated list of risks and mitigating actions; H) Updated list of issues and escalation path; and I) Record of any project decisions which apply to the service covered by this Statement of Work. The reports will be provided throughout the duration of this SoW to the service owner The Client may request regular meetings to discuss progress, quality and acceptance criteria with Endava in accordance with Schedule 8 (Governance) of the Framework Agreement. Endava will make all reasonable efforts to attend. 11 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 6. Risks Endava has identified the following high-level programme risks at the start of this Statement of Work. This list of risks will evolve during the course of the project. They will be monitored and managed by WorldPay. Risk Description Owner Likelihoo d Impact Mitigating Actions FIS Client Mastercard may require un  planned changes WorldPay Service Owner M H Endava will agree with the Client the best approach from the available options Loss of access to environments WorldPay Service Owner L H Endava will agree with the Client the best approach from the available options Implementation is outside GPPaaS resulting in unplanned technical challenges Endava M H Endava will agree with the Client the best approach from the available options Loss of critical resource Endava M M Completion of a skills hand-over plan and Endava to notify the Client as soon as a threat appears. Endava will agree with the Client the best approach from the available options. 7. ASSUMPTIONS 1. A Product Owner will be delegated from the Endava side to support the Endava development team and coordinate all actions related to clarifications, discussions, 12 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 acceptance, etc.. The product Owner will receive the required support from with the FIS Product organization 2. Mastercard & FIS test & development environments will be available for the Endava developers/testers as required by the team to meet the agreed deadlines 3. All backend APIs and other interfaces are available prior to the Service Start Date. 4. All used APIs have documentation that is still valid reflecting the true state of their completeness 5. Phase 1 is enough for the team to provide accurate estimates in the planned ABC workshop 6. The core team (senior roles) provided by Endava is available by the 15th of September with no more than 2 weeks delay while the rest of the team can be available by the end of Phase1 7. SAFe methodology is not required, and the development practices will follow Agile Scrum 8. SDLC practices common in the A2APM train currently in place will not be modified 9. SoW is signed by both parties by the agreed start date 10. The current requirements reflect the remaining work needed for the completion of the product as communicated by Worldpay 11. WPG Sandbox will be used for customer to test their code 12. The following technologies are used Java 8 and JGitFlow are used. No upgrade to Java 11 is required 13. WPG has not moved to OCP 4.0 14. This estimate does not take into account work by the HPP team to test against the new services 8. DEPENDENCIES Dependencies are managed in the project plan regularly updated by WorldPay and agreed with Endava. We have identified the following dependencies: Dependency Date required Owner WorldPay Product Manager Support person needs to be identified Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner Access to the FIS & Mastercard Systems & APIs required Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner Endava Core team to be available as planned Service Start Date Endava 13 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 Worldpay infrastructure teams will provide support Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner HPP team will need to test their services against work performed by the Endava teams Throughout the project WorldPay Service Owner SoW is signed by the start date Service Start Date Endava & WorldPay Service Owner 9. WORLDPAY RESPONSIBILITIES No Responsibility Date required Owner acceptance 1. The supply of all reasonable and relevant information and support from the Client staff to enable Endava to provide the Services detailed in this SOW Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner 2. Provision, in a timely manner, of written approvals of all deliverables described in this SOW Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner 3. Provision of laptops/terminals when Endava staff are required to work from the Client's offices; Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner 4. Provision of an account and relevant remote access for each team member (where appropriate); Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner 5. Provision of access to the relevant defect management/test management tool regarding the project for all team members Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner 6. Access to Client site as required for the delivery of these services Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner 14 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 7. While on client site all members of the team need access to appropriate working space (desk, chair, power point) Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner 8. Access to stable test environment, including all appropriate testing tools and the system under development Service Start Date WorldPay Service Owner 10. CONSTRAINTS COVID-19 measures may prevent work in the office, travels and face to face meetings if required. 11. LOCATION OF WORK The Deliverables will be provided from Supplier Service Locations in Romania, Moldova, Bulgaria, Serbia, Slovenia, Bosnia, Croatia, Macedonia or Colombia, Venezuela, Argentina, Uruguay and remotely from the Supplier personnel's location, or remotely from home with Worldpay's prior approval. Work required during non-working days per Romanian, Moldovan, Bulgarian, Serbian, Slovenian, Bosnian, Croatian, Macedonian and Colombian, Venezuelan, Argentinian, Uruguayan legislation will be confirmed with the Client and needed arrangements will be put in place to work accordingly to the project schedule and legal constraints regarding maximum work time. 12. KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TRANSFER The nature of the work to be delivered is such that knowledge and skills transfer needs to be prepared in advance and special sessions could be required. Outside special time planned for knowledge transfer activities, knowledge transfer will be a continual process throughout the engagement. 13. PERSONNEL The Parties estimates that the total Supplier Personnel to be allocated under this SoW is as follows: Role Type Estimated Quantity Dev Consultant (Java) 1 Dev. Manager 1 Developer (Java) 1 Product Owner 1 Senior Developer (Java) 2 Senior Tester 1 Test Automation Lead 1 Test Consultant 1 Design Lead (Java) 1 Grand Total 10 15 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 a. Working hours and overtime as stated in Schedule 7 of the Framework Agreement. b. Overtime will be subject to written approval by the Client in advance of the extended hours being worked. c. Expenses will be paid in line with WorldPay's expenses policy subject to (whenever reasonably practicable) written authorization by the Client in advance of the expense being incurred. d. Any changes to this Statement of Work will be executed using the Change Control process set out in Schedule 5 of the Framework Agreement. 14. FEES AND PAYMENT Services are provided on a time and material basis in accordance with the prevailing Rate Card as set out in the Framework Agreement. Period Estimated monthly staff cost Estimated monthly travel cost September 1 st, 2021 - June 30 th, 2023 £ 100,391 £0 Estimated Undiscounted Charges (staff and travel cost) for above period £ 2,208,609 Estimated Discounted Charges (18% discount staff and travel costs) for above period £ 1,811,059 The Parties agree that the above monthly cost is an estimate only based on the structure of the Endava team as of the Service Start Date, but the actual cost incurred per month can vary based on actual resource utilisation. Endava will invoice Worldpay for the actual man day provided per Supplier Personnel on a monthly basis and will provide a monthly forecast for the following month. Should there be a requirement to increase the Charges, this will be notified in advance to Worldpay, giving a minimum of 30 days' notice to increase the Charges in a CCN to this SoW, in accordance with the Change Control process set out in the Framework Agreement. The costs given in the tables(s) above are based on the undiscounted agreed rate card, are subject to the terms of the Framework Agreement and may change during the term of this contract. Currently all CEE based resource rates attract an 18% discount. In addition, any BRO On-call Support will be charged in accordance with Schedule 2 (Description of the Services and acceptance) of the Framework Agreement. 16 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 Overtime will be paid in line with Framework Agreement subject to written authorization by the Service Owner in advance of the extended hours being worked. The Client hereby acknowledge and agree that for the purposes of this Statement of Work, Endava will work with OceanoBe. The efforts provided by OceanoBe’s resources under this Statement of Work will be charged to the Client according to their roles as per Endava Tier 1 rates. List of roles that Endava can onboard from OceanoBe are Developer, Tester, Senior Developer, Senior Tester, Dev Consultant, Test Consultant, Design Lead, Senior Design Lead, Test Lead, Senior Test Lead, Scrum Master. The delivery dates and the actual cost of the project depend on the actual backlog, dependencies, team velocity other factors that cannot be foreseen now. Together with Worldpay, Endava will commonly agree “mitigation” actions which could mean increase team size, date changes or other actions as required by the circumstances. 15. TERMINATION FOR CONVENIENCE In accordance with clause 19.5(c) ii of the Framework Agreement 16. ADDITIONAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS (TO THOSE UNDER THE FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT) None. For and on behalf of For and on behalf of WORLDPAY (UK) LIMITED ENDAVA (UK) LIMITED By: By: Authorized Signatory Name: Mario Perez Authorized Signatory Name: John Cotterell 10/25/2021 | 09:02 EDT Date:   10/25/2021 | 05:25 EDT Date:   17 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 ANNEX 1 - BRO Model Process 1. The candidate services being considered for the BRO model under this Work Package are listed below: a. PBBA (Pay By Bank Application) is a new payment method being developed by MasterCard and piloted with Barclays and HSBC. It allows users to pay from their banking application using a simple 6 character code shown at checkout. The Pay By Bank Service is an adapter that sits between Worldpay's gateways and PBBA themselves, enabling any gateway to sdateprocess payment requests to them without knowing any specifics of the implementation. 2. The service can be deployed within a platform as a service cluster called RedHat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) which handles most of the operational aspects of the service. The platform itself handles all things related to availability, scalability, security and abstracts the interaction with the hardware resources. Services run within isolated components called Pods and this minimizes the risk of undesired cross services access. 3. Worldpay's processes for managing incidents out of hours will be followed. This includes but is not limited to alerts configured to go to the Global Technology Service Centre GTSC first line support team for service level breaches. Knowledge articles to be written by the BRO Team to define what steps need to be followed should the alert be raised. If the GTSC is unable to resolve the incident the escalation will be done to the BRO Team. 4. Worldpay will be responsible for assigning priority levels to the incidents in accordance with Annex 2. 5. The IT Supplier Personnel allocated to the BRO model will have a dedicated maintenance and support capacity. It is accepted that the capacity of the development team may reduce in order to perform Incident Management and Problem Management activities such as service restoration, root-cause analysis, remediation and mitigation against further incidents. This reduction in capacity may impact sprint commitments. If so, this will be clearly communicated between Endava and Worldpay leadership. 6. Endava will select the IT Supplier Personnel to be allocated to the BRO model based on their skills, motivation and availability for On-Call. The initial setup for the BRO support team will be by using the senior technical people from multiple teams, by 18 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 rotation. Any particular Problem that the senior technical person cannot solve during On-Call Support will be immediately picked by the team assigned to the service during Normal Working Hours. 7. Application and provision of the BRO model will not require Endava to access personal data. 19 DocuSign Envelope ID: BE366786-C014-4156-9F51-81233EB6B455 ANNEX 2 - BRO Incident Priorities Criticality/Priority levels Definition Critical (P1 Major Incident Event): • Immediate, widespread and large-scale Customer impact. • Immediate significant revenue impact to Worldpay with high long term fall out • Direct threat or damage to image, reputation or credibility of Worldpay - media attention highly likely. • Multiple business functions critically impacted. High (P2 Major Incident Event): • Immediate, widespread and large-scale Customer impact. • Immediate significant revenue impact to Worldpay with high long term fall out • Direct threat or damage to image, reputation or credibility of Worldpay - media attention highly likely. • Multiple business functions critically impacted. Medium (P3 Major Incident Event): • Immediate, widespread and large-scale Customer impact. • Immediate significant revenue impact to Worldpay with high long term fall out • Direct threat or damage to image, reputation or credibility of Worldpay - media attention highly likely. • Multiple business functions critically impacted. Standard (P4 Event): • Minor degradation of services delivered to single tier 1 Customer or multiple SMEs. • Significant degradation of service isolated to single non tier 1 Customer. • No immediate revenue impact. • Limited impact on critical business operations. Low (P5 Event): • Routine issue • Minor impact on single Customer • Minor business impact • Localized scope 20

(ii) For example: if Yodlee removes a Key Source, and that Key Source represents 5% of all aggregated accounts, then Company will receive a 5% reductions in its Minimum Monthly Active User fees. (3) Termination for Loss of Multiple Key Sources. Either party may terminate this Agreement if more than five Key Sources are removed under section 7(a)(5). (4) Re-Addition of A Key Source. PRIORITY DEFINITIONS. (a) Measurement of Service Issue. All Yodlee Service and software issues are measured by the following three categories: (1) level of business impact, (2) features being impacted, (3) number of users impacted. (b) Level of Business Impact. The business impact can range from high to low: (1) High business impact is when the company incurs significant loss due to loss of service or core system functions cannot be performed by the company or its end users. (2) Medium business impact is incurred when there is a partial loss of core functionality for a limited set of users, which indicates that there are some corner cases which require a detail analysis. Likely in order to troubleshoot these type of issues, Yodlee will need to collect user specific logs in order to identify a permanent solution. (3) Medium to low impact is when there is loss of minor functionality for the company or its end users. Low impact is when a small subset of the company's end users are impacted by the partial loss of minor functionality. (c) Feature Types: (1) In general for the Yodlee service and application there are core features and minor features. Core features are those process stop features. If a core feature is not performing it means that there is no work around and the company and its end users cannot perform core business service functions. (2) Minor feature set, as defined in this document, refer to the feature types which are not core but they may be supporting core features. These functions may not result in failure of core features but are likely to request the end user to undergo extra steps in order to perform a core system function. Look and feel and end user preferences are considered minor features. (d) User Population. Understanding the number of the users impacted is crucial in troubleshooting an issue. If all users are impacted it is a direct implication that there is an infrastructure problem or core software issue in the logical flow that needs to be addressed. If a low number of users are impacted it is also a direct implication that the scenario is likely a corner case which needs additional research in order to be addressed. PRODUCT LIFECYCLE. Yodlee will support the then-current Major Release of each Service plus two Major Releases back (e.g., if the then-current Major Release is 9.x, support per this SLA would be provided for versions 9.x, 8.x, and 7.x) (“Supported Releases”). If a Defect is discovered concerning a Supported Release, Yodlee will respond and address the Defect in accordance with the provisions of this SLA. Yodlee will make new Major Releases generally available to its company no more frequently than once per year on average. Once a Major Release is more than two versions older than the then-current Major Release, that version will be deemed “EOL" as of the General Release date of the newest Major Release. If Company does not upgrade from an EOL version to a Supported Release, the following will apply: (i) Defect support per this SLA will no longer be available, and Yodlee will attempt to answer questions concerning the EOL version but will not be bound by the requirements of this SLA; and (ii)Company will owe an additional annual EOL version fee equal to the greater of 30 percent (30%) of the Maintenance and Support Fee stated on the Fee Schedule or Twenty-Five Thousand Dollars ($25,000), effective immediately and continuing until such time that Company upgrades to a Supported Version. By way of example only: when the most recent Generally Available Major Release is version 9.x, versions 9.x, 8.x and 7.x are Supported Releases, while versions 6.x and older will be deemed EOL versions and will no longer be supported per this SLA. A company declines to upgrade from EOL version 6.x to a Supported Release, resulting in the Defect support provisions of this SLA no longer applying. In addition, that company immediately owes Yodlee an additional annual EOL version fee equal to 30% of the Maintenance and Support Fee stated on the Fee Schedule in that company's services agreement with Yodlee. 11. The investigation application consists of the following required data: • Full Legal Name(s) and AKAs • Government ID number or tax identifier • 10 Years of Residential Address History • 10 Years of Employment History • Highest Education Completed • Two Professional References • Explanation of any gaps of 90 days or more in any required history • Explicit Consent for the Investigation • Explicit Attestation of Veracity of Data Provided The investigation covers the following criteria for the previous ten (10) years (or 7 year search for states with reporting restrictions): • Social Security Number Trace • Criminal Check - Federal and all Counties of residence • Global Homeland Security Search (complies with US Patriot Act) • Credit Report • Residence Verification • Employment Verification • Education Verification • Last Supervisor and Professional Reference Verifications If there is a reasonable suspicion of intoxication or illegal drug use by a Yodlee employee, Yodlee reserves the right to require any employee to submit to drug and alcohol screening. Any employee determined to be in violation of policy, or who refuses to immediately submit to a drug and alcohol screening, will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment. The Supplier shall ensure that at all times it is operating in accordance with the terms of the Supplier Security Plan and maintains business insurance standard for the services they provide, but in no case less than those provided for in Schedule 6.1. b. The Supplier will on Worldpay's request provide Worldpay or any third party acting on behalf of Worldpay with copies of the Supplier Security Plan and any other documentation relating to the Supplier's compliance with the Agreement's information security requirements and will explain how the Supplier Security Plan meets such information security requirements. c. In the provision of the Services, the Supplier will adopt and use good development and coding practices in line with Good Industry Practice and adhere to any industry standards specified in the SOW. The Supplier will ensure that any application code or other materials developed for Worldpay are sufficiently tested and assured so as to ensure that common security flaws and vulnerabilities are not introduced into Worldpay's systems, products, services or websites. d. The Supplier shall perform Security Tests of its systems (“Supplier Security Tests”) in a manner and frequency expected in accordance with Good Industry Practice to ensure the Supplier is operating in accordance with the Supplier Security Plan and will share the report Summary of its annual independent Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Test with Worldpay on request. The Supplier shall permit Worldpay or a security consultant selected and approved by Worldpay to carry out penetration tests on the applicable services in Supplier's Stage environment (“Worldpay Security Tests”). Worldpay shall notify Supplier in advance and conduct the test per Supplier's security testing policy. The Supplier shall provide Worldpay with all reasonable assistance to enable Worldpay to perform the Worldpay Security Tests. e. If Worldpay considers (acting reasonably) that controls identified or tested in the performance of the Supplier Security Tests or the Worldpay Security Tests: i. are insufficient to ensure the integrity and security of Worldpay's Confidential Information; or ii. fail to meet the requirements of any Regulatory Authority applicable to Worldpay; or iii. fail to meet industry standards relating to data or information security, then Worldpay may require the Supplier to remedy such insufficiency or failure and the Supplier (at its own cost) shall, as soon as is reasonably practicable, make those modifications. Where the additional measures affect the Supplier's subcontractors, suppliers and agents, the Supplier shall procure that those measures are implemented by the relevant subcontractors, suppliers and agents. f. Upon any suspected or actual breach of any obligations or duties owed by the Supplier to Worldpay relating to information security or confidentiality, including any suspected or actual non-compliance with the Supplier Security Plan which affects the security and/or confidentiality obligation of the Supplier, the Supplier will immediately remedy the breach and will promptly: i. notify Worldpay of the breach and the Supplier's proposed remedial measures; ii. implement any actions or remedial measures at its own cost which Worldpay considers necessary as a result of the breach; and iii. provide Worldpay with evidence of the implementation of such remedial measures. 2. The Supplier will implement and operate: (a) where technically possible, up to date anti-virus software upon all systems and networks used in the provision of the Services; (b) the Services upon supported technologies which are kept up to date with the current versions; (c) a patch management process, which ensures patches are appropriately tested and deployed to rectify security vulnerabilities in a reasonable timeframe; (d) a vulnerability management program that is undertaken on a frequent basis (at least quarterly) that includes: • scanning the networks, infrastructure, applications and websites used in the provision of the Services; • validating any vulnerabilities found, and determining their criticality based upon industry recognized methods such as CVSS; • creating and undertaking a plan to remediate the discovered vulnerabilities, based upon their criticality, at its own cost and in a timely manner; Page 33 of 40 DocuSign Envelope ID: A352F2B4-3E3A-401C-8305-F08613625F02 (e) regular penetration tests upon the networks, infrastructure, applications and websites used in the provision of the Services, no less than once per calendar year. Supplier undertakes to resolve, or otherwise mitigate, all critical and high risk findings in no less than one calendar month; (f) standards to ensure that its systems are configured in a secure state, in line with industry recognized best practices, such as NIST or the Center of Internet Security; (g) robust processes to ensure that access to Worldpay Data under its control is restricted to those individuals whom are explicitly authorized to access such data in the course of delivering the Services. Access shall be limited to those with a business need for such access and to those privileges needed to fulfil that need only. Access shall be assigned using unique logon credentials to ensure accountability is maintained; (h) a robust and enforceable password policy in place that mandates the use of complex passwords and forces users to periodically change their password; (i) strong authentication methods (two-factor authentication) for those of its Personnel who work remotely and for those with administrative privileges upon systems used to provide the Deliverables or Services. Such access must be via encrypted communications; (j) mechanisms to prevent the unauthorized removal of Worldpay Data from the Supplier's networks via technologies such as removable media devices, the internet, email or instant messaging services; (k) strong encryption technologies to protect logon credentials, and Worldpay Data during transmission and storage; (l) encryption technologies upon portable devices such as laptops, PDAs and smartphones, in order to protect any Worldpay information shared via, or stored upon, such technologies; (m) physical and logical controls to mitigate the risk of unauthorized intrusion to Supplier's premises, networks and systems; • physical controls must include: a. an auditable electronic access system that requires physical access tokens (such as swipe cards, biometric token, keys or fobs) to achieve access; b. CCTV coverage of all entry points; c. intruder detection systems and burglar alarms; d. processes to grant access only to authorized individuals; e. processes to revoke physical access when no longer required; f. processes to manage visitors are authorized and supervised. • logical controls must include: a. appropriately configured and maintained firewalls; b. up to date intrusion detection systems; c. centralized logging systems that records networks and systems activity and retains the ability to inspect these logs in the event of a suspected or realized security breach; d. the monitoring and inspection of such logs by persons separate from those responsible for administration of networks and systems; (n) systems and software development processes to ensure that commonly known security flaws (such as those defined by the Open Web Application Security Project) are not introduced into systems used to supply the Services. Such controls must include: a. sufficient training for its software developers to ensure that the probability of security flaws being introduced is minimalized; b. the testing of application and website code to eliminate security flaws; (o) separate environments between test and production systems and will ensure that no production data of Worldpay is used in test systems; (p) robust processes to ensure that changes to the premises, networks, systems and software used to supply the Services are appropriately tested and implemented to limit the potential of service degradation; (q) processes to continually monitor its networks and systems for potential or actual security breaches; (r) processes to ensure that any Worldpay data is retained in accordance with a data retention policy which complies with Worldpay's requirements, and applicable legal or regulatory requirements; (s) processes to promptly return and/or erase all data in Supplier's possession or control, at the request and option of Worldpay, in a manner that maintains its confidentiality and integrity, as agreed between the parties; Page 34 of 40 DocuSign Envelope ID: A352F2B4-3E3A-401C-8305-F08613625F02 (t) processes to ensure that all information pertaining to, provided by, or owned by Worldpay is securely destroyed to beyond the point of recovery (once approved by Worldpay) as soon as it is outside the agreed retention policy or no longer required for a valid business purpose, including electronic and physical information assets. Certificates of destruction will be retained for audit purposes; (u) training in accordance Good Industry Practice on secure software development at least annually for Personnel involved in the architecture and design, and development and testing of Worldpay software; (v) secure SDLC (secure development lifecycle) processes based on Good Industry Practice; and (w) automated or manual analysis of the security of any code developed and vulnerabilities must be remediated prior to deployment to Worldpay 3. Where all, or part of, the Services are provided using online services (i.e. accessible via the internet), the Supplier must ensure that adequate protection is in place to mitigate the risk of denial-of-service (DoS) threats. 4. The Supplier shall ensure that information security awareness and training programmes are provided for those responsible for handling Worldpay data, upon hire and on at least an annual basis. 6. The Supplier shall immediately notify Worldpay of: (i) any actual, or reasonably suspected breach of Supplier security, its services or systems impacting upon Worldpay; (ii) any actual, or reasonably suspected unauthorized access to or acquisition, use, loss, destruction, alteration, compromise or disclosure of any of Worldpay's Customer data held by or on behalf of the Supplier; or (iii) any circumstance pursuant to which applicable law requires notification of such breach to be given to affected parties or other activity in response to such circumstance (each, a “Security Breach”). 7. In the event of a Security Breach, the Supplier shall: (i) promptly, but in no case more than one (1) Business Day after the Supplier becomes aware of an actual breach or ten (10) Business Days of a suspected breach, provide to Worldpay a detailed description of the incident, the data accessed, the identity of individuals or entities involved, if available, and such other information as Worldpay may request concerning the Security Breach; (ii) provide Worldpay with the name and contact information for an employee of the Supplier who shall serve as the Supplier's primary security contact and shall be available to assist Worldpay as a contact in resolving obligations associated with the Security Breach; (iii) assist Worldpay in investigating, remedying and taking any other action Worldpay deems necessary regarding any Security Breach and any dispute, inquiry or claim that concerns the Security Breach; (iv) facilitate interviews with the Supplier's employees and third party service providers, such as computer security or forensic investigation firms assisting in responding to the Security Breach; (v) make available all relevant records, logs, files, report, and analysis regarding the Security Breach, as well as any other materials required to comply with applicable law, regulation, industry standards or as otherwise reasonably required by Worldpay; (vi) shall take prompt actions to ensure that such Security Breach or potential Security Breach will not recur; and (vii) cooperate with Worldpay and any law enforcement or regulatory official investigating such Security Breach. Notwithstanding the foregoing, to the extent not prohibited by applicable law, Worldpay shall make the final decision on notifying its customers, users, employees, service providers and/or the general public of such Security Breach or any other breach related to security which is not a Security Breach, and the implementation of the remediation plan. If a notification to a Worldpay's customer or users is required under any applicable law, guidelines or best practice, then in addition to all other costs arising out of or in connection with such Security Breach, and without prejudice to all other rights and remedies available to Worldpay under this Agreement, at law or in equity, subject to the limitation of liability in section 15(b), Supplier shall reimburse Worldpay for all reasonable notification related costs arising out of or in connection with any such Security Breach, including but not limited to, credit monitoring services. 8. The Supplier will give the Worldpay Group reasonable assistance to comply with these requirements to the extent that such requirements relate to this Agreement or an SOW. e. The Supplier represents and warrants that it maintains adequate internal audit functions to assess internal controls in its environment and to protect the security and confidentiality of Confidential Information. If the Services include or Supplier otherwise has access to Worldpay Confidential Information then, at least as often as once per year and at Supplier's sole cost and expense, the Supplier agrees to undertake, an independent ISAE 3402/SSAE-18 SOC 2 Type II audit or comparable independent attestation to confirm Supplier's controls over its processes and its compliance with Good Industry Practice. Supplier agrees to maintain the types of coverage identified below covering Supplier activities, those of any and all subcontractors, or anyone directly or indirectly employed by any of them, or anyone for whose acts any of them may be liable, throughout the term of the Agreement and thereafter until the expiration of all applicable statute of limitations. 1.2. Commercial General Liability Insurance with limits of not less than $1,000,000 per occurrence for bodily injury, personal injury and property damage. Coverage must include the following: blanket contractual liability, products and completed operations, independent contractors, severability of interest and waiver of subrogation against all parties described as additional insured. Worldpay, LLC and Group Companies are to be endorsed as additional insured. Limits may be achieved through a combination of primary and excess limits. 1.3. Workers’ Compensation Insurance in compliance with statutory limits of each jurisdiction and Employer’s Liability Insurance with limits of not less than $1,000,000 per accident. Coverage must include a waiver of subrogation. 1.4. Automobile Liability with limit not less than $1,000,000 per occurrence for bodily injury and property damage if the Supplier owns, leases, hires or uses non-owned vehicles in the performance of this Agreement. Coverage must include a waiver of subrogation against all parties described as additional insured. 1.5. Professional Liability/Errors & Omissions/Computer Security and Privacy Liability with limits not less than $5,000,000 per claim and in aggregate. Such coverage must include the following: Professional Liability Insurance covering actual or alleged acts, errors or omissions committed by the Supplier, its agents or employees, or sub-contractors arising out of the performance of this Agreement. Computer Security and Privacy Liability policy shall expressly provide, but not be limited to, coverage for the following perils: (i) unauthorized use/access of a computer system; (ii) defense of any regulatory action or investigation involving unauthorized access to or acquisition of information and adequacy of security measures or practices; (iii) failure to protect Confidential Information (personal and commercial information) from unauthorized access, acquisition, or disclosure; (iv) breach expense coverage, whether or not required by any statute, law or regulation including but not limited to: (i) notification costs (including mailing and call center); (ii) costs of computer security firms, forensic investigators, reasonable attorney’s fees; (iii) fraud or identity theft mitigation and insurance services; or (iv) credit monitoring. 1.6. The Supplier shall be responsible for all claims expenses and loss payments within the policy deductible or self-insurance retention. If the policy is subject to an aggregate limit, replacement insurance will be required if it is likely such aggregate will be exceeded. 1.7. Such insurance shall be subject to the terms and conditions and exclusions that are usual and customary for this type of insurance. 1.8. If this insurance is provided on a claims-made basis, the Supplier shall maintain continuous insurance coverage during the term of this Agreement and in addition to the coverage requirements above, such policy shall provide that: (i) policy retroactive date coincides with or precedes the insured initial services under the Agreement and shall continue until the termination of the Agreement (including subsequent policies purchased as renewals or replacements); (ii) policy allows for reporting of circumstances or incidents that might give rise to future claims; and (iii) if the policies in force during the term of this Agreement are not renewed or replaced, an extended reporting period of not less than three (3) years shall be purchased by the Supplier with respect to events which occurred but were not reported during the term of the policy or ongoing coverage is maintained. All insurance shall be written through companies having an A.M. Best's rating of at least A-VII or with such other companies as may reasonably be approved by Worldpay. All such liability insurance maintained by the Supplier or any subcontractor shall be endorsed as primary and non-contributory to any such insurance maintained by Worldpay. Certificates of Insurance evidencing such coverage shall be furnished to Worldpay prior to commencement of this Agreement and at each subsequent policy renewal date. The Certificates shall make best commercial efforts to provide for not less than thirty (30) days written notice to Insured prior to policy cancellation, non-renewal, or material change. In the event of cancellation, non-renewal, or material change of said insurance during the period of time insurance coverage is required under this Agreement, the Supplier must provide proof of replacement insurance prior to the effective date of such cancellation, non-renewal, or material change. Page 37 of 40 DocuSign Envelope ID: A352F2B4-3E3A-401C-8305-F08613625F02 PART A: PERSONAL DATA SCHEDULE 7 SAFEGUARDING DATA 1. In this Schedule, the following terms have the following meanings: Cardholder Data: means information relating to a cardholder including, but not limited to, credit card numbers, transactional information and any other Personal Data relating to such cardholder; Data Controller: means the party determining the purposes and means of Processing Personal Data; Data Processor: means the party responsible for Processing Personal Data on behalf of a Controller; Data Protection Legislation: means the provisions of applicable Law which relate to the protection of individuals with regards to the Processing of Personal Data to which a Party is subject, including without limitation US federal and state privacy laws and regulations, the GDPR, the Data Protection Act 2018, the Data Protection Directive 95/46/EC, the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000, the Telecommunications (Lawful Business Practice (Interception of Communications) Regulation 2000, the Electronic Communications Data Protection Directive 2002/58/EC, the Privacy and Electronic Communications (EC Directive) Regulations 2003, and in each case any regulations thereunder and, where applicable, the guidance, directions and codes of practice of the UK Information Commissioner’s Office and of any other competent privacy Regulatory Authority; Data Subject: an identified or identifiable natural living person; GDPR: means the General Data Protection Regulation ((EU) 2016/679); Personal Data: means any information relating to a Data Subject from which the Data Subject can be identified, directly or indirectly; and Processing: means any operation or set of operations which is performed on Personal Data or on sets of Personal Data, whether or not by automated means, such as collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction. 2. In accordance with the provisions of the Safeguarding Data clause, if the Supplier has access to any Personal Data, then the provisions of Part A of this Schedule shall apply. All such Personal Data shall be and remain the property of Worldpay. Unless otherwise required by Law, the Supplier shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, return or if Worldpay so elects, destroy (and in the case of destruction, certify that such destruction has taken place), all Personal Data upon any of the following: (a) at Worldpay’s request; (b) the termination or expiration of this Agreement or the relevant SOW; or (c) when the Personal Data is no longer required by the Supplier for the provision of the Services. 3. The Supplier shall comply at all times with the Data Protection Legislation and shall not perform any of its obligations under this Agreement or any SOW in such a way as to cause Worldpay to breach any of its applicable obligations under the relevant Data Protection Legislation. 4. The Supplier shall not use any Worldpay Data for any purpose other than the rendering of Services to Worldpay and shall not disclose the Worldpay Data to any third parties or commercially exploit the Worldpay Data. The Supplier shall and shall procure that its Personnel shall not attempt to access or allow access to Worldpay Data to which they are not entitled or that is not required for the performance of the Services. 5. To the extent that the Supplier processes any Personal Data on behalf of Worldpay, the Supplier acknowledges that it is the Data Processor in relation to such data and shall procure that its Personnel shall: (a) obtain prior written consent from Worldpay in order to transfer the Personal Data to any sub-contractors or material third parties for the provision of the Services; (b) Process the Personal Data strictly in accordance with instructions from Worldpay or the terms of this Agreement and then only to the extent, and in such manner, as is necessary for the provision of the Services, or as is required by Law or any Regulatory Authority; (c) ensure that only the Personnel shall have access to the Personal Data and that all such Personnel have undergone training in the Data Protection Legislation and in the care and handling of Personal Data and are under an appropriate duty of confidentiality at least equivalent to those set out in the confidentiality clause; (d) implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to safeguard against unauthorized Processing (including accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, unauthorized disclosure of, or access to or alteration of, Personal Data transmitted, stored or otherwise Processed); Page 38 of 40 DocuSign Envelope ID: A352F2B4-3E3A-401C-8305-F08613625F02 (e) not process Personal Data in a public place or any location where such Personal Data may be viewed by others, including in waiting areas, on public transport or across unencrypted public networks; (f) promptly refer to Worldpay (and at the latest within two (2) Business Days) any queries relating to Personal Data Processed on behalf of Worldpay from Data Subjects, any information commissioner or any other Regulatory Authority, which Worldpay may decide to resolve at its discretion, and at no additional cost, promptly provide such information to Worldpay as Worldpay may reasonably require to allow it to comply with the rights of the Data Subjects, including subject access rights, or information notices or queries requested by a Regulatory Authority; (g) promptly carry out any request from Worldpay requiring the Supplier to amend, transfer or delete the Personal Data or any part of the Personal Data; (h) provide to Worldpay on request such information as may be reasonably requested by Worldpay regarding the steps the Supplier has taken to comply with its obligations under this Schedule 7 Part A and the Data Protection Legislation including, without prejudice to Worldpay’s rights under the Audit clause, submitting to audits, including inspections, conducted by Worldpay or a third party auditor mandated by Worldpay; (i) immediately inform Worldpay if, in the Supplier’s opinion, a Worldpay instruction infringes the Data Protection Legislation; (j) not process or otherwise transfer any Personal Data outside the European Economic Area or USA (whichever is the Processing location with respect to the applicable SOW under which the Personal Data is Processed) without Worldpay’s express prior written consent and if such consent is provided, shall only process or otherwise transfer such Personal Data on terms that comply with applicable Data Protection Legislation (insofar as it relates to Worldpay as Data Controller) and in accordance with a cross border data transfer mechanism, such as Privacy Shield Certification (see https://www.privacyshield.gov/welcome), EEA Standard Contractual Clauses for the transfer of Personal Data to Processors established in third countries and/or Binding Corporate Rules. The Supplier must immediately notify Worldpay if the Supplier ceases to, or makes a determination that the Supplier can no longer meet this requirement, and will promptly take all necessary steps to remedy the non-compliance. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Worldpay hereby acknowledges, excepts from such limitations, and expressly consents to Yodlee’s subsidiary in Bangalore, India, Yodlee Infotech Private Limited; and (k) maintain all such records of its processing activity as are required of it as a Data Processor acting in accordance with the Data Protection Legislation and on request of Worldpay, make such records available to any Regulatory Authority. 6. Without prejudice to paragraphs, 5(a) and 5(i) above, or the assignment clause, where the Supplier wishes to appoint a subcontractor who shall process the Personal Data, the Supplier shall contract with such subcontractor on terms which are the same as or substantively similar to, and no less onerous than, the terms set out in this Agreement in connection with Personal Data and as if the subcontractor were the Supplier. 7. The Supplier acknowledges that any consent to a subcontractor provided by Worldpay may be withdrawn by Worldpay if and to the extent that Worldpay reasonably believes that the Personal Data or the rights of the Data Subjects may be compromised by the relevant subcontractor. Any subcontractor approved by Worldpay under this Agreement shall not be entitled to, and the Supplier shall ensure that they do not appoint, any further third party or subprocessor, other than with the consent of Worldpay and pursuant to the terms of Part A of this Schedule. 8. The Supplier shall immediately notify Worldpay upon becoming aware of a breach or suspected breach in respect of any Personal Data Processed by or under the control of the Supplier and shall on an ongoing basis provide Worldpay with all such further relevant information in connection with the breach as such information becomes available so as to enable Worldpay to determine whether to notify the breach to the applicable Regulatory Authority and Data Subjects. Such notification shall at a minimum: (a) describe the nature of the Personal Data breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of Data Subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of Personal Data records concerned; (b) the name and contact details of the Data Protection Officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained; (c) the likely consequences of the Personal Data breach; and (d) the measures taken or proposed to be taken by the Supplier to address the Personal Data breach, including, where appropriate, measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects. Page 39 of 40 DocuSign Envelope ID: A352F2B4-3E3A-401C-8305-F08613625F02 PART B: CARDHOLDER DATA 1. If the Supplier has any access to Cardholder Data, any environment storing, processing, or transmitting Cardholder Data, or can affect the security of Cardholder Data or a Cardholder Data environment, Part B of this Schedule shall apply. 2. The Supplier will maintain full compliance with the current version of the applicable standards of the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council (including Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (“PCI DSS”), the Payment Application Data Security Standard and the PIN Transaction Security Standard) and any other applicable payment card data security standards, as each may be modified from time to time (the “PCI Standards”), at its own cost throughout the term of the relevant SOW. 3. The Supplier acknowledges that it is responsible for the security of Cardholder Data which the Supplier and its Personnel possess or otherwise store, process or transmit on behalf of Worldpay and/or its customers, including to the extent that the Supplier's acts or omissions could impact the security of the environment or systems used by Worldpay (or its customers) to store, process or transmit Cardholder Data. 4. The Supplier will appoint a qualified security assessor (“QSA”) to verify its compliance with the PCI Standards as a Level 1 Service Provider, and obtain a PCI DSS Report on Compliance (“ROC”). 5. The Supplier will provide evidence of its compliance with the PCI Standards annually and as Worldpay reasonably requests from time to time by: (a) providing Worldpay with an Attestation of Compliance (“AOC”) signed both by the Supplier and the QSA and dated within the prior twelve (12) months; (b) providing Worldpay with a copy of the executive summary from the latest ROC from the QSA or a letter of attestation, describing the scope and services assessed by the QSA; and (c) providing to Worldpay in writing details of its procedures and policies relating to and implementing compliance with the PCI Standards. PART C: COMPANY OBLIGATIONS. a. Company Security Breach: i. Company will notify Yodlee of any material security breach of the Company Site within twenty-four (24) hours of discovery. ii. Company will reasonably cooperate with Yodlee in the investigation of a security breach. Company will provide access to information required by Yodlee, and will make personnel available to the extent necessary to assist Yodlee in determining the impact to Yodlee. All information exchange for this activity is Confidential Information. iii. Yodlee may suspend the Services upon written notice to Company in the event of a security breach until Yodlee has determined that the incident does not pose a security or reputational risk to Yodlee. Company will not be responsible for any fees during the period of such suspension. If Company and Yodlee are unable to agree on reinstatement of the Services after a security breach, Company and Yodlee may immediately terminate all or part of the Services or the Agreement without cost or penalty. Scope This Section 2 outlines the deliverables, milestones, duration, assumptions and constraints for this engagement. 2.1. Scope of Work 2.1.1. Aggregation Platform • Provision and deploy the latest version of the Yodlee Aggregation Platform on new stage and production environments. • Configure the ability to aggregate Bank, Investment, Credit Card, Loan, Mortgage, Real Estate, Other Assets and Other Liabilities account types. • Configure the Aggregation platform for Company to support usage of Yodlee APIs including Synchronized API Data Extracts. • Deploy and enable the latest version of RESTful APIs for Aggregation. Yodlee Confidential Page 3 of 9 DocuSign Envelope ID: A352F2B4-3E3A-401C-8305-F08613625F02 September 30, 2019 2.1.2. Hosted Responsive FastLink for Aggregation • Provision and configure the latest version of the hosted responsive FastLink application on stage and production environments to provide clients with a means to easily aggregate their accounts. • Provide ability to accommodate Multi-factor Authentication ("MFA"), One-time Password ("OTP"), Token and CAPTCHA authentication scenarios. • Configure FastLink based on preferences identified by Company in the FastLink Product Cobrand Deployment Kit ("CBDK") artifact. • Brand FastLink based on the preferences and User Interface ("UI") images and styles identified by Company in the FastLink UI CBDK artifact. 2.1.3. Synchronized Data Extracts a. Enable Synchronized API Data Extracts in stage and production environments for Company to access aggregated data. b. Provide consulting and guidance on the usage of the Data Extract APIs. c. Provide support during integration and acceptance testing. 2.1.4. Professional Services Consulting a. Provide SSO SAML consulting and UI integration consulting for integration of the hosted FastLink application. b. Provide best practices consulting to assist Company to establish connectivity to the simplified RESTful APIs, Register and/or Login users through SAML, and retrieve user account, transaction and holdings data via the APIs. c. Provide consulting for API usage regarding performance and security. d. Provide System Integration Testing ("SIT") and User Acceptance Testing ("UAT") consulting. e. Provide production rollout and environment shakeout consulting. f. Provide post implementation support for four (4) weeks. 2.1.5. Customer Care and Standard Reports a. Implement Customer Care and Standard Reports tools on production environment. b. Provide up to four (4) hours of remote training on Customer Care and Standard Reports tools to Company. Yodlee Confidential Page 4 of 9 DocuSign Envelope ID: A352F2B4-3E3A-401C-8305-F08613625F02 September 30, 2019 c. Provide access to User Guides associated with the use of the Customer Care and Standard Reports tools to Company. 2.2. Assumptions 2.2.1. Aggregation Platform 1. A new Cobrand application will be deployed on stage and production environments. 2. Stage and production environments will be configured with the latest version of simplified RESTful APIs and the responsive framework for hosted components. 3. Company will integrate to the Yodlee APIs using SAML 2.0 authentication methodology. 2.2.2. Hosted Responsive FastLink 1. FastLink will be integrated and supported for web and mobile browser only. 2. FastLink will be deployed on Company domain. Company will provide Secure Sockets Layer ("SSL") certificates as requested by Yodlee to install on Yodlee servers and create Domain Name Service ("DNS") record as specified by Yodlee. 3. Yodlee will provide destination Uniform Resource Locator ("URL") for linking to FastLink. 4. Company will require and manage acceptance of Terms and Conditions. 5. Company will provide digital assets including images, fonts, styles, UI specifications, etc. as per timelines agreed by both project teams. 6. Company will provide help text and other configurable text information as per timelines agreed by both project teams. 7. Same branding will apply to both web and mobile browser views. 8. Company to follow integration approach as specified by Yodlee. 2.2.3. Professional Services Consulting 1. Company and Yodlee shall ensure that the required business and technology teams are made available for the duration of the project. 2. Onsite travel is out of scope unless requested with advance notification and agreed to by Yodlee and applicable expenses covered as outlined in section 3.
